programme.title: BizTalk
programme.desc: BizTalk is CGTN's premier business dialogue program. It brings together the titans of business, architects of policy, and scholars of the economy to help viewers better make sense of the dynamics that shape China and the world. More than just a conversation, BizTalk equips viewers with a deeper understanding of the Chinese economy and distills complex global economic undercurrents into clarity in an era of unprecedented change.

Join us on a journey to experience the vibrant pulse of China's economy and immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of Chinese culture.

programme.title: Path to Prosperity: Putting people the first
programme.desc: For the past decades, the word “people” has always been highlighted at the country’s economic development. In this episode of “Path to Prosperity”, CGTN’s Yang Zhao takes us to explore how China’s development is shared by all.

programme.title: Path to Prosperity: China's high quality development
programme.desc: With the world facing mounting uncertainties, China is turning to high-quality development as the driving force behind long-term stability and shared progress. In this episode of Path to Prosperity, CGTN's Michael Wang explores how China is shifting from a phase of rapid expansion to one focused on the quality and sustainability of growth.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 What's My Car Worth?

programme.title: The Big Blocks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 What's My Car Worth?
programme.desc: Bill Stephens and Keith Martin take a ride on the wild side when they appraise American big block beasts, including a barn find Boss 429, a Shelby GT500, and a Sting Ray.

programme.title: American Icons
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 What's My Car Worth?
programme.desc: Bill Stephens and Keith Martin appraise muscle cars including a Plymouth Superbird and a Mustang Mach 1 at the Petersen Automotive Museum Garage Sale and Swap Meet in LA.

programme.title: The Dogs of Hurricane Dorian
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug Thron takes his infrared drone from the hurricane-devastated Bahamas to the wildfire scorched hills of California, locating and rescuing dogs, horses, and more.

programme.title: Lost Dogs of Louisiana
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Laura, Doug heads to Louisiana to help a local firefighter find his lost dog and begin rescue operations in the hard-hit city of Lake Charles.

programme.title: 13 Days After Hurricane Laura
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: With the help of expert animal rescuer, Aja Estro, Doug continues his tireless search and rescue missions across the town of Lake Charles following Hurricane Laura.

programme.title: Oregon Fire Cats
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug ventures into the charred neighborhoods of Talent, OR with an old friend, Shannon Jay, to save any of the unlucky felines left behind in the wildfire evacuations.

programme.title: Puerto Rico Rescue Pups
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug is called to Puerto Rico to help old friend and rescue partner, Aja Estro, with the massive stray dog population and hoarding cases across the island.

programme.title: Chasing Ghost
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug checks in on some of the dogs he’s rescued before turning his attention to the high desert outside LA and a boxer who’s spent 15 months fending for itself.

programme.title: Island Dogs
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In our season opener, Doug takes his drone to the Dominican Republic to rescue puppies that have been abandoned in the municipal town dump.

programme.title: Urban Hyenas
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug travels to Malawi, in Central Africa, to work with hyena researchers who are eager to employ his drone. What the infrared camera shows them will surprise them all.

programme.title: Bats of Malawi
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug visits Malawi, in Central Africa, to experiment in ways his drone can assist wildlife conservation research… pioneering work that can revolutionize field science.

programme.title: Dixie Fire Foxes
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: After the Dixie Fire devastates the CA town of Greenville, Doug heads in with his old friend Shannon to rescue the lost cats and wild animals that have been left behind.

programme.title: Tornado Town
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In the season finale, Doug takes his drone to the tornado-ravaged towns of Kentucky to rescue the slew of cats and dogs that have been lost in the brutal December storm.

programme.title: Kristen Bell
programme.desc: At age 19, on a missionary trip to a clinic in Brazil, Kristen Bell helped to deliver two babies. The experience ignited her nurturing nature, which endures today.

programme.title: Shaquille O'Neal
programme.desc: Shaquille O’Neal went from being poor and bullied – and becoming a bully himself – to fame in the NBA. The greatest influence on Shaq’s life was his step-father.

programme.title: Samuel L. Jackson & LaTanya Richardson Jackson
programme.desc: At age 20 Samuel L. Jackson served as an usher at Martin Luther King’s funeral. Jackson and his wife LaTanya have fought for civil rights around the world.

programme.title: LeVar Burton
programme.desc: LeVar Burton entered the seminary at 13 years old. But after deciding the church didn’t have the answers to his questions about life he changed his focus to theater.

programme.title: Joe Namath
programme.desc: Joe Namath grew up in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania. After his parent’s divorce, Joe turns to sports.

programme.title: MrBeast
programme.desc: Jimmy Donaldson, aka MrBeast, is the world’s first digital philanthropist. Jimmy built a viral video empire based on the joy he gets from helping others.

programme.desc: In Siberia, Edik has to face wolves to protect his 4000 reindeer herd during the spectacular migration to the Great North.

programme.desc: Banda must climb giant trees to gather honey, the elixir of life.

programme.title: Bull Jump
programme.desc: Follow the epic ordeals of Kolé, a young man who live in Ethiopia. To achieve this dual status, he must embark on a long journey, which will take him to the bull jumping ceremony.

programme.desc: The Tornadoes suffer a series of devastating losses and look to heal deep wounds.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: This film follows the race to generate vast power from thin air - the wind. One of the world's biggest windfarms is being built off the English coast.

programme.title: Aviation
programme.desc: The way we fly is about to change, driven by a new breed of aviators not afraid to think differently. Could the days of the jet age be numbered?

programme.title: Fusion
programme.desc: It is the greatest technological challenge ever undertaken by humankind. The quest to produce the ultimate energy solution‚ Fusion.

programme.title: Tidal
programme.desc: The power of the ocean's tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth. Teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flows of water.

programme.title: Maritime
programme.desc: Shipping companies and engineers are creating new machines to make their industry greener using a resource that has moved man across oceans for thousands of years...Wind.

programme.title: Solar
programme.desc: The sun is the biggest source of energy in the solar system. Innovators are searching for new ways to capture more of the sun's power.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Construction

programme.title: Myths of the Congo - Deep and Dangerous
programme.desc: The river that swallows all rivers - this is what the natives call it. In reality, the Congo, when considering its water masses, is the second largest and the deepest river in the world. At its source in the north of Zambia, it starts out as a mere trickle, but on its journey westwards it grows and grows, becoming ever mightier and with it, the animals, too: the shoebill stork hides in the dense papyrus. Metre-long pythons hunt for their prey in trees and huge hippos fight for power and respect in the water. To survive in the Congo, animals have to adapt to extreme conditions. Here, evolution has spawned unique creatures: fish with lungs, wings and those that go hunting on land. The Congo...

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The Parque Nacional Peneda-Gerês is the only national park in Portugal. An area of almost 700 square kilometers, located in the extreme north of Portugal. Barren and rocky ridges in the plateaus, contrast with large forests and lush ground vegetation in deep valleys, crossed by lakes and rivers. The park is known for its oak forests, which are predominantly pedunculate and Pyrenean oaks. Among the typical animals of the park are the small Garrano ponies, a very old breed of horse and the only one in Europe that still lives in the wild.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The highest mountain range in Portugal is the Serra da Estrela. The episode embarks on a voyage of discovery to adventurous rock formations and villages steeped in tradition. The nature park is the largest protected area on the Iberian peninsula. In the mountain range we accompany the young scientist Ana Matos, who wants to breathe new life into old traditions, and cheese maker Maria Natália Lopes. She watches over more than 350 sheeps.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 South West Portugal: Alentejano and Costa Vicentina
programme.desc: In the southwest of Portugal lies the little known Parque Natural do Sudoeste Alentejano e Costa Vicentina. It encompasses a narrow coastal strip that runs along the coast to the south of Portugal. Sparsely populated, this coastal region, which was placed under protection in 1988, is considered one of the last intact ecosystems in Europe. The steep cliffs, the almost constant wind and high waves have ensured that mass tourism has not gained a foothold here. There are still near-natural forests and a diverse bird life.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: Madeira - Portugal's autonomous island in the Atlantic Ocean, is closer to the African coast than to the mother country Portugal, from which it is separated by about 900 kilometers. The island's name comes from Portuguese sailors who claimed the uninhabited isle for themselves in 1419. Madeira means wood and that was available in abundance. Almost the entire surface was covered by dense forest. Since 1982, two-thirds of the landscape has been protected.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The "Parque Natural da Ria Formosa" is one of the largest lagoon conservation areas in Europe. Bordered by five natural islands. A mosaic of sandbanks, brackish and freshwater lagoons and salt marshes. In 2010, the "Ria Formosa" was chosen as one of the seven natural wonders of Portugal. It is a unique ecosystem: in the winter months, more than 20,000 birds gather here. In addition, the nature park has one of the largest seahorse populations internationally. More than half of all fish species in the Atlantic are said to spawn in the lagoon.

programme.title: Stories of the Mediterranean Forest: Sierra Morena
programme.desc: The Mediterranean Basin is one of the planet’s most biologically rich and complex regions. The crossroads of Europe, Asia and Africa is considered to be one of Earth’s biodiversity hotspots. A vast number of both animal and plant species unique to the region live in its various habitats. The Mediterranean Basin is located in one of the planet’s temperate zones. The subtropical climate makes it colder and wet here in winter, hot and dry in summer and mild and rainy in autumn and spring.

programme.title: The Canary Islands - In the Shadows of the Volcanoes
programme.desc: The Canary Islands were born in the depths of the ocean. Forged by fire and sculpted by winds and waves, this volcanic land offers landscapes of colossal force and almost unreal beauty.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book – and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere – in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius – nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius – by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs – Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao Tomé and Príncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde – the islands of Saudade, of longing. For Stéphane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: Myths of the Congo - Apes and Aliens
programme.desc: The Congo, mighty and deep like no other river - yet still a retreat and a habitat for several of our world's strangest animals. Our closest relatives live deep inside the dense jungles: three of the four giant ape species have made the Congo basin their home. Rich in extraordinary footage, the second episode of "Myths of the Congo" also presents exciting insights into one of the most mysterious and dangerous regions on earth.

Here, evolution has spawned unique creatures: fish with lungs, wings and those that go hunting on land. The Congo...

programme.title: mareTV: Corsica - Fascinating Mountain World in the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Corsica looks like an alpine landscape in the Mediterranean, an island with dramatic rock formations, romantic bays and proud inhabitants who see themselves first and foremost as Corsicans and only then as French. The Greeks in ancient times called the island Kalliste: the beautiful. We explore this fascinating mountain world in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 America's National Parks - Grand Canyon
programme.desc: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States. The Grand Canyon is 277 miles (446 km) long, up to 18 miles (29 km) wide and attains a depth of over a mile (6,093 feet or 1,857 meters). The canyon and adjacent rim are contained within Grand Canyon National Park, the Kaibab National Forest, Grand Canyon–Parashant National Monument, the Hualapai Indian Reservation, the Havasupai Indian Reservation and the Navajo Nation. President Theodore Roosevelt was a major proponent of preservation of the Grand Canyon area and visited it on numerous occasions to hunt and enjoy the scenery.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 America's National Parks - Gates of the Arctic
programme.desc: Gates of the Arctic National Park and Preserve is an American national park that protects portions of the Brooks Range in northern Alaska. The park is the northernmost national park in the United States, situated entirely north of the Arctic Circle. The park is the second largest in the US, slightly larger in area than Belgium. Gates of the Arctic was initially designated as a national monument on December 1, 1978, before being redesignated as a national park and preserve upon passage of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act in 1980. A large part of the park has additional protection as the Gates of the Arctic Wilderness that adjoins the Noatak Wilderness. They form the...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 America's National Parks - Great Smoky Mountains
programme.desc: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is an American national park in the southeastern United States, with parts in Tennessee and North Carolina. The park straddles the ridgeline of the Great Smoky Mountains, part of the Blue Ridge Mountains, which are a division of the larger Appalachian Mountain chain. The park contains some of the highest mountains in eastern North America, including Clingmans Dome, Mount Guyot, and Mount Le Conte. The border between the two states runs northeast to southwest through the center of the park. The Appalachian Trail passes through the center of the park on its route from Georgia to Maine. With 12.5 million visitors in 2019, the Great Smoky Mountains National...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 America's National Parks - Yellowstone
programme.desc: Yellowstone National Park is an American national park located in the western United States, largely in the northwest corner of Wyoming and extending into Montana, and Idaho. It was established by the U.S. Congress and signed into law by President Ulysses S. Grant on March 1, 1872. Yellowstone was the first national park in the U.S. and is also widely held to be the first national park in the world. The park is known for its wildlife and its many geothermal features, especially Old Faithful geyser, one of its most popular. While it represents many types of biomes, the subalpine forest is the most abundant. It is part of the South Central Rockies forests ecoregion.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 America's National Parks - Yosemite
programme.desc: Yosemite National Park is a place of superlatives: with towering cliffs and giant sequoias, home to coyotes, black bears and the most elusive of all: the bobcat. Watch this documentary with ist spectacular shots, aerial views and time-lapse shots and learn some new facts about the biodiversity in one of North Americas most spectacular National Parks.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 America's National Parks - Saguaro
programme.desc: Saguaro National Park is an American national park in Pima County, southeastern Arizona. The 92,000-acre (37,000 ha) park consists of two separate areas—the Tucson Mountain District (TMD) about 10 miles west of the city of Tucson and the Rincon Mountain District (RMD) about 10 miles east of the city—that preserve Sonoran Desert landscapes, fauna, and flora, including the giant saguaro cactus.An inventory of medium and large mammals in the park confirmed the presence of 30 species in Saguaro National Park between 1999 and 2008. Of these, 21 were found in the Tucson Mountain District and 29 in the Rincon Mountain District. A partial list of the park's mammals includes cougars, coyotes,...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 America's National Parks - Olympic
programme.desc: Olympic National Park is an American national park located in the State of Washington, on the Olympic Peninsula. The park has four regions: the Pacific coastline, alpine areas, the west side temperate rainforest and the forests of the drier east side. Within the park there are three distinct ecosystems which are subalpine forest and wildflower meadow, temperate forest, and the rugged Pacific coast. President Theodore Roosevelt originally designated Mount Olympus National Monument on 2 March 1909. The monument was redesignated as a national park by Congress and President Franklin Roosevelt on June 29, 1938. In 1976, Olympic National Park was designated by UNESCO as an International...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 America's National Parks - Everglades
programme.desc: North America’s National Parks are world famous and their breathtaking landscapes fascinate millions of visitors. This spectacular series will show you what happens beyond the lookouts. Everglades National Park is an American national park that protects the southern twenty percent of the original Everglades in Florida. The park is the largest tropical wilderness in the United States, and the largest wilderness of any kind east of the Mississippi River. An average of one million people visit the park each year. Everglades is the third-largest national park in the contiguous United States after Death Valley and Yellowstone. UNESCO declared the Everglades & Dry Tortugas Biosphere Reserve in...

programme.title: King of the Mountains - Golden Eagle
programme.desc: Aerial shots of mating Golden eagles, a clash between a Golden and a White-tailed eagle, and an intimate glimpse into their nesting grounds combine to create a spectacular film. Tracking these majestic birds reveals the wild nature of their hunting grounds, showcasing the diverse animal and plant life that share their habitat with the 'king of the skies.' Viewers are brought up close as the eagle effortlessly glides over forests and canyons, abruptly diving in a breathtaking pursuit of prey. Witnessing these birds in their natural habitats is witnessing them at their finest. Embark on a magnificent journey through the skies and landscapes with us.

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Alpine Whistleblowers - On the Playground of the Marmots
programme.desc: These peculiar and roughly rabbit-sized rodents enjoy great popularity at the Großglockner in the Austrian Alps. Before the last ice age, marmots used to live in the lowland of Tirol, but with the melting of the glaciers they were driven higher up into the mountains – a trend that will continue given the current climate change. Today, they simply feel too warm below 800 meters. In spring, as soon as the temperatures begin to rise, marmots leave their dens after a nearly six-month long hibernation. After eating their share and recovering from the long fast, losing up to a third of their body weight, the most important thing is founding a family. And that sometimes involves rather fierce...

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.desc: The moon disappears behind the horizon and the stage is set for a new day in the Alps of Berchtesgaden.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Bavaria - In The Shadow of the Watzmann.
programme.desc: Mighty and mysterious, King Watzmann sits above Germany's only alpine national park.

programme.title: Winter Journey to the Polar Circle (Exploring Norway on the Nordlandsbanen)
programme.desc: The Nordland Railway in Norway, travels from Trondheim through the isolated regions of Trendelag and Nordland. After Mo I Rana, it traverses the Arctic Circle and ends in the northern Norwegian town of Bodø. The railway covers a distance of some 729 kilometres, passing by dense, snow-covered forests, frozen fjords and snow-capped mountains. Temperatures of sometimes minus 30 degrees are quite normal here for months, on many days there is no more than five hours of daylight. Kindergarten teacher Kaia Aarstrand und her husband, Bjørnar, a technician for the municipality, live with their four boys in Aursletta, deep within the Vistenfjord, far away from civilization. All made possible by the...

programme.title: mareTV: Corsica - Fascinating Mountain World in the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Corsica looks like an alpine landscape in the Mediterranean, an island with dramatic rock formations, romantic bays and proud inhabitants who see themselves first and foremost as Corsicans and only then as French. The Greeks in ancient times called the island Kalliste: the beautiful. We explore this fascinating mountain world in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 America's National Parks - Grand Canyon
programme.desc: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States. The Grand Canyon is 277 miles (446 km) long, up to 18 miles (29 km) wide and attains a depth of over a mile (6,093 feet or 1,857 meters). The canyon and adjacent rim are contained within Grand Canyon National Park, the Kaibab National Forest, Grand Canyon–Parashant National Monument, the Hualapai Indian Reservation, the Havasupai Indian Reservation and the Navajo Nation. President Theodore Roosevelt was a major proponent of preservation of the Grand Canyon area and visited it on numerous occasions to hunt and enjoy the scenery.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 America's National Parks - Gates of the Arctic
programme.desc: Gates of the Arctic National Park and Preserve is an American national park that protects portions of the Brooks Range in northern Alaska. The park is the northernmost national park in the United States, situated entirely north of the Arctic Circle. The park is the second largest in the US, slightly larger in area than Belgium. Gates of the Arctic was initially designated as a national monument on December 1, 1978, before being redesignated as a national park and preserve upon passage of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act in 1980. A large part of the park has additional protection as the Gates of the Arctic Wilderness that adjoins the Noatak Wilderness. They form the...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 America's National Parks - Great Smoky Mountains
programme.desc: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is an American national park in the southeastern United States, with parts in Tennessee and North Carolina. The park straddles the ridgeline of the Great Smoky Mountains, part of the Blue Ridge Mountains, which are a division of the larger Appalachian Mountain chain. The park contains some of the highest mountains in eastern North America, including Clingmans Dome, Mount Guyot, and Mount Le Conte. The border between the two states runs northeast to southwest through the center of the park. The Appalachian Trail passes through the center of the park on its route from Georgia to Maine. With 12.5 million visitors in 2019, the Great Smoky Mountains National...

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 America's National Parks - Yellowstone
programme.desc: Yellowstone National Park is an American national park located in the western United States, largely in the northwest corner of Wyoming and extending into Montana, and Idaho. It was established by the U.S. Congress and signed into law by President Ulysses S. Grant on March 1, 1872. Yellowstone was the first national park in the U.S. and is also widely held to be the first national park in the world. The park is known for its wildlife and its many geothermal features, especially Old Faithful geyser, one of its most popular. While it represents many types of biomes, the subalpine forest is the most abundant. It is part of the South Central Rockies forests ecoregion.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesn't square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the company's new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angélique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sébastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devil's Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devil's Plateau." What's more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valérie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators' initial findings, the 38-year-old nurse's aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Légeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss police's investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators' intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators don't understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-d'Ablois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Crémel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. There's no doubt that it's murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel they're holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.desc: Wrestler Ivan Radocaj killed in Inwood; wiretap uncovers disturbing conspiracy plot.

programme.title: Nicholas Brophy
programme.desc: Nicholas Brophy is excited for his senior year, goes out to visit a friend and never returns.

programme.title: Victoria Shachtay
programme.desc: Victoria survives a horrific crash, wins a large settlement and then dies after an explosion.

programme.title: Keith Black
programme.desc: Taekwondo instructor Keith Black disappeared without a trace; years later that the truth comes out.

programme.title: Dean Frank
programme.desc: Frances Thompson claims she killed Dean Frank in self-defense, but the investigation reveals otherwise.

programme.title: Kurt Douglas Johnson
programme.desc: Kurt Johnson disappears after a ride home on New Year's Eve 2010 in Cooperstown, ND, revealing a secret.

programme.title: Larisa Dumansky/Piper Streyle
programme.desc: Young mothers in Sioux Falls are stalked by a sadistic killer; evidence and a child lead to arrest.

programme.title: Alice Pepperl
programme.desc: Alice Pepperl's death in a motel room hints a quarter-holed lucky coin may link her to the killer.

programme.title: Mark & Sean Cavaness
programme.desc: Dr. Dale Cavaness is respected, but when his son is slain, dark secrets emerge-both sons shot at 22.

programme.title: Jake Millison
programme.desc: Near Gunnison, CO, Jake Millison goes missing; months later, a break reveals a greed-fueled plot.

programme.title: Make a Mark
programme.desc: Bryan Jr. makes a mark in the self-proclaimed log home capital of the world. Beat engineers a yard challenge.

programme.title: The Getaway
programme.desc: As winter approaches, the rush to build two homes is on. Beat and Joel build a daredevil mountain bike jump.

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: In upstate New York, Beat builds three grandiose gazebos for two brothers with neighbouring properties.

programme.title: Planes, Cranes and Automobiles
programme.desc: Beat begins to build a 15,000 square foot mansion with logs so massive they tax the crew to the limits.

programme.title: Good as New
programme.desc: On a build in Alberta, Joel and his right-hand man Shawn are challenged by broken logs and stubborn headers.

programme.title: Barn Burner
programme.desc: After Beat and Sam build a home in Alberta, the clients egg them on to a paint ball battle on their acreage.

programme.title: Behind the Sawdust
programme.desc: This special takes you behind the scenes, featuring impressive builds and entertaining moments from Season 1.

programme.title: Cliffside Castle
programme.desc: Beat takes on one a perilous build, a luxury twin-turreted vacation home on the edge of 100-foot cliff.

programme.title: Coming Home
programme.desc: In Alberta, Beat is tasked with building one man’s dream home on the picturesque farmland where he grew up.

programme.title: It’s a Dirty Job
programme.desc: A reluctant Joel joins forces with his wife to construct a backyard obstacle course.

programme.title: Out of the Ashes
programme.desc: Peter helps restore a Manitoba couple’s love for logs by building a home to replace the one they lost to fire.

programme.title: Frying Pan into the Fire
programme.desc: Bryan Jr. whips up an outdoor kitchen before hitting the beach in search of the ultimate driftwood bar.

programme.title: Going for Gold
programme.desc: Joel starts on a 20,000-sq./ft. mansion complete with walk through tree and 3-story spiral log staircase.

programme.title: Take to the Trees
programme.desc: Peter may have met his match when he builds a mountainside ski cabin for a client experienced in building.

programme.title: Living the Dream
programme.desc: Beat builds a lottery winner’s 7,000-sq.ft. dream home in northern Alberta.

programme.title: Night Sweats
programme.desc: Beat battles a stuck truck in the middle of the night, then builds in darkness to meet his deadline.

programme.title: Log Building for Dummies
programme.desc: Joel pinch hits in Oregon, by building a home he’s never seen, using a crane he hopes he’ll never see again.

programme.title: Weather or Not
programme.desc: Peter battles the elements to build a retirement home for childhood sweethearts.

programme.title: Hometown Hero
programme.desc: Beat creates a cozy cabin in Germany, while Peter and Sr. win a Guinness World Record with a log car.

programme.title: Heaven’s Gate
programme.desc: Bryan Jr. feels the heat to recreate the cozy log home a British Columbia couple lost to a fire.

programme.title: Under the Gun
programme.desc: Beat constructs a luxury fishing lodge in northern British Columbia.

programme.title: Cowboy Confidential
programme.desc: Beat and André are lassoed into building an elaborate carved archway for the Williams Lake Stampede.

programme.title: History Lesson
programme.desc: Bryan Sr. and Joel brave the British Columbia backwoods to save a historic game warden's cabin.

programme.title: Where There's Smoke
programme.desc: The heat is on Bryan Jr. to build a deluxe, log smoker for the family fishing resort.

programme.title: Behind the 8 Ball
programme.desc: André is on cue to deliver a log pool table for a Williams Lake pub until the owner racks up his request.

programme.title: Giddy Up
programme.desc: Beat saddles up for Germany and the creation of a western-style guesthouse to match a saloon he built.

programme.title: Reach for the Sky
programme.desc: Peter and Bryan Sr. defy gravity by erecting a 50-foot log tee pee in Canada's North.

programme.title: All Shook Up
programme.desc: Joel builds an earthquake-proof home on Vancouver Island.

programme.title: Homes, Sweet Homes
programme.desc: A fresh inside peek into some of the Timber Kings' most spectacular and unique finished homes.

programme.title: Truck Overboard
programme.desc: Joel wrecks an 18-wheeler during a winter build in Ontario, Beat and André sell a thousand year old tree.

programme.title: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Beat’s Arkansas house build is in trouble when delivery trucks arrive out of order, Bryan Jr. remodels a bar.

programme.title: Heir Apparent
programme.desc: Bryan Jr. takes his son to Missouri and they manage to assemble a house despite themselves.

programme.title: Hard Hat & Home
programme.desc: Beat delivers a home in Utah to a frugal client who wants to do everything for himself.

programme.title: Jolly Ole Island
programme.desc: Joel assembles a millionaire’s retreat on a private island in England, and Beat gets an emotional assignment.

programme.title: Peter in a Pickle
programme.desc: Peter goes to Scotland and discovers Bryan Sr. has followed; Beat and André face a client with buyer’s remorse

programme.title: Wilderness Retreat
programme.desc: Joel builds an enormous house in the wilderness for a millionaire client he’s never met.

programme.title: German Efficiency
programme.desc: Beat’s schedule is thrown by German customs and there’s only one way to catch up.

programme.title: Arkansas Shuffle
programme.desc: Beat sets logs in the pouring Arkansas rain for a client who orders renovations on the fly.

programme.title: The Boss Can Build
programme.desc: André the GM and master salesman must go to Ontario and lead his first build in more than 10 years.

programme.title: Old Dog, New Tricks
programme.desc: Bryan Sr. resurrects an old crane dubbed "Rust Bucket" to complete a fishing cabin.

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: In Kansas, tensions run high when André muscles in on Sam's big build. Bryan Jr. hosts an ice-cutting party.

programme.title: A Big Deal
programme.desc: Joel hopes his contract for four cabins in Michigan will land Pioneer an order for sixteen more.

programme.title: Pig in Mud
programme.desc: In the Prairies, Peter gets stuck in the mud, trying to make a client's dreams come true.

programme.title: High Rollers
programme.desc: Just hours from Manhattan, Beat creates a country retreat for a demanding French financier.

programme.title: Trial by Fire
programme.desc: In foggy Newfoundland, Peter builds a duck-hunting cabin and gets initiated into island culture.

programme.title: Out on a Limb
programme.desc: In Northern BC, a challenging modern log home has Beat and his crew risking life and limb.

programme.title: Active Duty
programme.desc: In California, Joel is under the gun, with a job that's behind schedule before it even begins.

programme.title: Canada’s Sunshine Coast, BC
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Epic Trails S2 - "Canada’s Sunshine Coast, BC"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson heads to British Columbia’s beautiful Sunshine Coast, to explore the 112-mile long Sunshine Coast Trail and to test his nerves at the Coast Gravity Downhill Mountain Bike Park.

programme.title: Peak District & Derbyshire
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Epic Trails S2 - "Peak District & Derbyshire"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson heads to the Peak District in England, to tackle the 268-mile Pennine Way—Britain’s oldest and most challenging National Trail.

programme.title: Juneau, Alaska
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Epic Trails S2 - "Juneau, Alaska"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson heads deep into the backcountry to explore the mountains, glaciers and wildlife around Alaska’s capital city of Juneau.

programme.title: Marrakech
programme.desc: Cody is in Marrakech, Morocco, for a local exploring adventure on BMX-bikes through an old medina, along graffiti walls, night markets and a forbidden hotel.

programme.title: Berlin
programme.desc: Historical Berlin offers Josh two days of adventures and hidden treasures including a former U.S. Spy Station used during the Cold War and an abandoned garage.

programme.title: Tbilisi
programme.desc: Cody discovers the unknown beauty of Tbilisi exploring abandoned Cold War bomb shelters, a derelict weather station and an abandoned cable car station.

programme.title: Charleroi
programme.desc: Local exploring in industrial Charleroi, brings Cody to abandoned factories and an unknown spot full of colorful graffiti. An old casino awaits to be explored.

programme.title: Mexico Part 2
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 Road Less Traveled S4 - "Mexico Part 2"
programme.desc: Jonathan's Mexico adventure takes a new turn; the continuous pumping of Mexico’s lakes has caused not only a water shortage, but a seismic issue. He pinballs around the vast city to gain an understanding into this complex issue.

programme.title: Fiambala
programme.desc: In this episode, Rob and Dave drive through Fiambala and decide to stop at the town’s most famous site the naturally occurring hot springs baths.

programme.title: Crater
programme.desc: Rob and Dave continue their journey to Salta, but before they go anywhere near the glorious wine capital they make a detour the Cerro Blanco, a large volcano.

programme.title: Stunning Scenario
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Roads End S1 - "Stunning Scenario"
programme.desc: A day of gruelling grape picking lies ahead and the duo discover a new love for the country’s greatest export.

programme.title: Ancient forests of Tsitsikamma
programme.sub-title: S01 : E21 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "Ancient forests of Tsitsikamma"
programme.desc: Xander takes full advantage of the opportunities given to him by experiencing all that Tsitsikamma has to offer, whether that be bungee jumping, quad biking, or visiting a 60’s diner.

programme.title: The Animals of Oudtshoorn
programme.sub-title: S01 : E22 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "The Animals of Oudtshoorn"
programme.desc: Xander starts his day by receiving a surprising phone call from Adam before heading to Chandelier Game Lodge to visit Africa’s most exquisite animals.

programme.title: Creations of Prins Albert
programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "Creations of Prins Albert"
programme.desc: Despite unforeseen travel complications, Xander travels through a picturesque mountain pass to Prince Albert to enjoy the olive farms and other specialties the town has to offer.

programme.title: Yorkshire Dales, England
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Yorkshire Dales, England"
programme.desc: Imagine a 26-pub, 7-day, 60-mile pub-crawl! Doing a traditional ‘ramble’ through the stunning Yorkshire Dales region of northern England, the brother’s stride through the moors and dales and peaks and valleys - legs and livers intact.

programme.title: Erg Chigagga, Sahara, Morocco
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Erg Chigagga, Sahara, Morocco"
programme.desc: From Marrakesh, the brothers take a series of local Berber taxis over the High Atlas Mountains and down into the Draa Valley until the road ends at the edge of the great sand sea of the Sahara where they bury some treasure.

programme.title: Episode Eleven
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Our Auto Expert S1 - "Episode Eleven"
programme.desc: Nik explores the Mazda CX30 Turbo and Toyota 4Runner. He highlights the 2022 VW IDA and off-roads in the Hyundai Santa Cruz. Hopes are high for the Lexus LF-Z Concept Electric.

programme.title: Episode Twelve
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Our Auto Expert S1 - "Episode Twelve"
programme.desc: Nik praises the 2021 Lincoln Aviator GT Hybrid. Mike showcases the 2021 Audi Q5. Nik explains Jeep's luxury transformation of the Wagoneer. He tests the hands-free drive of the 2022 Chevy Bolt SUV.

programme.title: A Dangerous Game
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Morbidelli Rising S1 - "A Dangerous Game"
programme.desc: There’s danger on the track at the year's biggest race, Mugello. Franco battles to focus on his goal of ‘Rookie of the Year’ while around him his team implodes.

programme.title: Believe
programme.desc: Franco continues to claw back points and has a nail biting wait to find out if he has won ‘Rookie of the Year’. Will he be riding again next year?

programme.title: Long Beach California
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Close Proximity S1 - "Long Beach California"
programme.desc: Matt Field and his and his solid team of experts head down to Long Beach, California to begin the Formula Drift Championship series.

programme.title: Atlanta
programme.desc: Coming off a good start to the Formula Drift Tour, Matt Field and his crew prep, pack, and fly to Atlanta for next stop of the Formula Drift championship.

programme.title: FMX Nomads
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 FMX Nomads S1 - "FMX Nomads"
programme.desc: Join Dan Whitby, Samson Eaton and Arran Powley for a day in the life of globetrotting freestyle motocross team, Bolddog.

programme.title: The Test
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Test"
programme.desc: The new version of the Flying Kestrel is ready to be put to the test at one of the most state of the art wind tunnels. Has the team done enough to create a record-breaking car?

programme.title: The Reveal
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Reveal"
programme.desc: At Santa Pod raceway, engineer and driver Jon Webster reveals the final Flying Kestrel to Joel and Nigel McNully, he gives them a tour around the finished car and shows them all the changes he has made, all to hopefully get a land speed record.

programme.title: Andy Soucek - Bentley Continental
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Endurance - 24 Hours at Spa S1 - "Andy Soucek - Bentley Continental"
programme.desc: In this profile, we get to know Andy Soucek competing in the Bentley Continental at the 2018 Total 24 Hours of Spa race held at the Spa-Francorchamps circuit.

programme.title: Mark’s Little Demon
programme.sub-title: S16 : E03 Graveyard Carz S16 - "Mark’s Little Demon"
programme.desc: The famous 1971 Mr. Norm’s Dodge Demon, 340 6-pack is cruising through the shop.

programme.title: A Hunk of Burning Love
programme.sub-title: S16 : E04 Graveyard Carz S16 - "A Hunk of Burning Love"
programme.desc: What do you get when you cross a bird with a fish? The one and only Phoenix ‘Cuda!

programme.title: Braking Challenge
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Supercar Showdown S2 - "Braking Challenge"
programme.desc: It’s week three and the contestants are preparing for a new round of challenges.

programme.title: Driver Changes
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Supercar Showdown S2 - "Driver Changes"
programme.desc: It’s week four and the contestants are preparing for a new round of challenges...and for our eight remaining rookies the elimination room looms.

programme.title: Slow Speed
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Ultimate Rider S1 - "Slow Speed"
programme.desc: To test the rookies’ fundamental skills of accelerating, braking, and cornering, Moto GP legend Daryl Beattie and Team Honda Racing boss Paul Free have designed both a skills session and a points challenge.

programme.title: 21st Birthday
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Ultimate Rider S1 - "21st Birthday"
programme.desc: Which contestant can get the furthest on 500ml of fuel while maintaining a set race speed? Can Glenn take out top spot and receive the best birthday present he could ask for?

programme.title: A Fly in the Ointment
programme.sub-title: S06 : E08 Graveyard Carz S6 - "A Fly in the Ointment"
programme.desc: Mark & Royal go on a fieldtrip. Will removes a fly from the Phantom Cuda’s paint & Alyssa gets a lesson on a paint booth technique.

programme.title: Will Gets Grumpy
programme.sub-title: S06 : E09 Graveyard Carz S6 - "Will Gets Grumpy"
programme.desc: Dave brings in his own engine to test run. The Ghouls fine tune Torino’s GTX and Mark and Alyssa meet a client with a special car.

programme.title: Phantom's 440 Six Barrel
programme.sub-title: S06 : E10 Graveyard Carz S6 - "Phantom's 440 Six Barrel"
programme.desc: Will takes a protege in the paint booth. Mark explains the suspension on a Mopar and Will and Alyssa struggle with the billboard graphic.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Car Crews with Supercar Blondie S1 - "Los Angeles"
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie goes to Hollywood arriving in a million dollar V12 Ferrari. In the ‘City of Angels’ Alex is brought into contact with the Brotherhood of Racing, a community of drivers looking to create safe racing conditions for amateurs.

programme.title: Houston
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Car Crews with Supercar Blondie S1 - "Houston"
programme.desc: Given special access to a 2 million dollar exclusive McClaren Senna, Supercar Blondie digs under the surface to uncover gang feuds in the SLAB (Slow, Low and Bangin’) community and meets up with legendary hip hop artists Slim Thug and Paul Wall.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Car Crews with Supercar Blondie S1 - "Las Vegas"
programme.desc: Supercar Blondie arrives in Las Vegas in a million dollar Lamborghini SVJ roadster. Taken under the wing of Patrick, founder of the Junkyard Pirates, Alex is brought into the rat rod world - home to American mavericks and outsiders.

programme.title: The T Bird
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Geared Up S1 - "The T Bird"
programme.desc: A 1957 Ford Thunderbird gets the restoration treatment with new paint, interior, and a rebuilt V8 motor.

programme.title: The 300
programme.desc: An ultra rare 1957 Mercedes Benz 300 SL Roadster is resto-modded using a modern Mercedes Benz SLK 230 as a donor vehicle.

programme.title: It is what it is..
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 King of the Hammers: The Ultra4 Saga S1 - "It is what it is.."
programme.desc: Team Indiana, the underdogs of Ultra 4, take the fight to the enemy.

programme.title: Learning to win
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Inside Moto S1 - "Learning to win"
programme.desc: We discover 2 ways of achieving success: The wild talent of the young Jack Miller, and the perfectionist tenacity of Tito Rabat.

programme.title: Ready to race
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 The Flying Kestrel S2 - "Ready to race"
programme.desc: The Flying Kestrel team heads back to the 2 mile long runway at Elvington, where last year Jon Webster crashed the car. He drives it in anger for the first time since that fateful day but have they done enough?

programme.title: Braking Challenge
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Supercar Showdown S2 - "Braking Challenge"
programme.desc: It’s week three and the contestants are preparing for a new round of challenges.

programme.title: Driver Changes
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Supercar Showdown S2 - "Driver Changes"
programme.desc: It’s week four and the contestants are preparing for a new round of challenges...and for our eight remaining rookies the elimination room looms.

programme.title: Slow Speed
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Ultimate Rider S1 - "Slow Speed"
programme.desc: To test the rookies’ fundamental skills of accelerating, braking, and cornering, Moto GP legend Daryl Beattie and Team Honda Racing boss Paul Free have designed both a skills session and a points challenge.

programme.title: 21st Birthday
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Ultimate Rider S1 - "21st Birthday"
programme.desc: Which contestant can get the furthest on 500ml of fuel while maintaining a set race speed? Can Glenn take out top spot and receive the best birthday present he could ask for?

programme.title: Episode Thirteen
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Our Auto Expert S1 - "Episode Thirteen"
programme.desc: Nik explores BMW's electrified future. Mike off-roads in the Nissan Titan Pro-4X. Cadillac shines with the new Escalade. Nik highlights Toyota Tundra's value. He enjoys the Jeep Wrangler Rubicon 392.

programme.title: Morgan Hill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Close Proximity S1 - "Morgan Hill"
programme.desc: After a loss against Formula Drift newcomer Faruk Kugay in Atlanta, Matt is back in Morgan Hill, cleaning up the Drift Cave before heading to Orlando.

programme.title: Orlando
programme.desc: Following a disappointing 12th place finish in the Formula Drift series stop in Orlando, drift car driver Matt Field prepares for the next stop: Wall Speedway.

programme.title: Long Break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Close Proximity S1 - "Long Break"
programme.desc: After a week-long break, Matt Field and his crew are refreshed and ready for their next stop in Montreal, Canada.

programme.title: Bad Decisions
programme.desc: Ethical hunters make the right decisions every day. This week Wardens find themselves confronted with Bad Decisions.

programme.title: Fly By
programme.desc: Wardens set up a check station in Region 5. When the hunters decide to run it the chase is on.

programme.title: Leming Bear Attack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Fight to Survive S1 - "Leming Bear Attack"
programme.desc: This week, we'll learn the harrowing tale of a father's desperate attempt to save his son's life from a grizzly bear attack while out hunting together.

programme.title: Season Recap
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Fight to Survive S1 - "Season Recap"
programme.desc: This week, we take a look back at our season's survival stories with a more in-depth look with the help of former Army Special Forces soldier, Terry Schappert.

programme.title: Far North Bluewater Mission
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 South Seas Spearo S2 - "Far North Bluewater Mission"
programme.desc: 60 nautical miles + 200kg of Burley divided by 3 keen spearos = mayhem. The team go wide this week, overnighting aboard The Orca in 1000m of water in the Far North, in an attempt to create a 24-hour trail capable of attracting in who knows what!

programme.title: Hardcore Hapuka
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 South Seas Spearo S2 - "Hardcore Hapuka"
programme.desc: We return to Fiordland in the hope of going one step better in slotting a hapuka on a spear, but the presence of Bluefin Tuna off the coast, and Wapiti Bulls on the slip faces proves a tempting distraction from the task at hand!

programme.title: Back in the Brooks
programme.sub-title: S08 : E01 Dropped S8 - "Back in the Brooks"
programme.desc: For the first time in years, the Keefer Brothers boots hit the gravel in remote Alaska.

programme.title: Maniac Mountain
programme.desc: Over a decade later Maniac Mountain provides another first for the brothers.

programme.title: Mountain Monsters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Man Eats Wild S1 - "Mountain Monsters"
programme.desc: Mario is on the search of the outer limits of the mountains to find himself a monster red deer. His arrow successfully finds a big red and he showcases some recipes he learnt from the southern regions of Italy.

programme.title: Boars and Prehistoric Fish
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Man Eats Wild S1 - "Boars and Prehistoric Fish"
programme.desc: Mario returns to his homeland in Australia to help a friend out, but drama strikes and Mario finds himself in crocodile infested water plucking fish out with his bare hands.All these delicious bush treats are prepared in a termite oven made by Mario.

programme.title: New Year In The Emergency Room
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Emergency S1 - "New Year In The Emergency Room"
programme.desc: Tet, the Vietnamese New Year, is pivotal in Vietnam. Yet, for paramedics, it's a bustling time. Similarly, in Sydney, New Year's is famous, but New South Wales Ambulance paramedics have little time for festivities.

programme.title: Slums
programme.desc: Since 1991, Mumbai’s population has doubled, with over half living in slums. Buenos Aires faces similar struggles, where 7.6% reside in shantytowns. Paramedics often can’t reach these areas and must rely on local volunteers.

programme.title: Traffic
programme.desc: Thailand’s roads are among the deadliest in the world, with 24,000 deaths in 2016—73% of them motorcyclists. In Bangkok, paramedics remain constantly vigilant. Meanwhile, in Benin, daily fatal accidents keep Cotonou’s firefighters busy with medical evacuations.

programme.title: Surviving a Bear Attack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Bear Attack"
programme.desc: Nick and Laura create kick-ass tests to explore the immense power and startling speed of grizzly bears. They use Hollywood stunt tools to experience an attack. Then try to recreate a “miracle” arrow shot that saved a man from being killed by a bear.

programme.title: Surviving Treestand Accidents
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Survival Science S1 - "Surviving Treestand Accidents"
programme.desc: In this exciting episode we’ll find out the reasons why tree stand accidents happen and how we can prevent them. Cool science mixed with dynamic experiments send our hosts, our stunt team and our special crash test dummies plummeting to the ground.

programme.title: Sniper Attack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Survival Science S1 - "Sniper Attack"
programme.desc: Military snipers are trained in a variety of skills: detection, stalking, camouflage, infiltration, special reconnaissance and target acquisition. Bottom line, a ton of cool shooting and science for Nick and Laura to explore!

programme.title: High Waters
programme.desc: Stuck in the tent for days, Chris and Kaid finally get a break in the weather. They realize the rain has flooded the river dangerously. Nonetheless, the hunt for big game persists.

programme.title: Moose Fever
programme.desc: Chris and Kaid pursue a big bull moose, and Kaid finds himself with hide in his crosshairs. Casey and R.L. continue their search for big game. The high river waters refuse to quit raging.

programme.title: Weary Travelers
programme.desc: R.L. and Casey venture far from camp to access prime moose territory during the rut. Meanwhile, bad weather prompts Chris to scout a potential new extraction point.

programme.title: Road Warrior
programme.desc: Wardens set up a decoy to stop road hunting in Region 7. It's not long before they catch a shooter.

programme.title: Last Hurrah
programme.desc: A veteran warden works his last season. Wardens look back at the decorated career of one of the best.

programme.title: After The Fall
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Fight to Survive S2 - "After The Fall"
programme.desc: A rock-climbing disaster hurtles climber Craig DeMartino 100 feet down a granite cliff. A shattered heap of broken bones, Craig clings to life. In a split second, Craig’s life becomes an inspiring fight to survive.

programme.title: A River's Grasp
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Fight to Survive S2 - "A River's Grasp"
programme.desc: In an isolated mountain river, Fisherman Dean Ririe becomes hopelessly trapped under a boulder in water up to his neck. In icy waters that should kill a man, Dean fights for his life miles from help.

programme.title: Atv Nightmare
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Fight to Survive S2 - "Atv Nightmare"
programme.desc: A father and son camping trip turns into a desperate fight to survive when John Sloot is crushed under an ATV. Now his 10 year-old son, Cody must brave the wilderness alone to get help.

programme.title: Arctic Apex
programme.desc: The top of the food chain comes into question as the Keefer brothers find themselves between a grizzly and a wolf.

programme.title: Valley of Riches
programme.sub-title: S08 : E04 Dropped S8 - "Valley of Riches"
programme.desc: Animals are everywhere, but that doesn't mean anything is going to be easy.

programme.title: Bull Run
programme.desc: Sunrise gives life to the valley and animals are on the move.

programme.title: Pitt Island Expedition
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 South Seas Spearo S2 - "Pitt Island Expedition"
programme.desc: Following a ridiculous sequence of events in Fiordland, the team saddle up and head for the hapuka haven of the Chatham Islands, where they spend a few days diving the spectacular & remote Pitt Island.

programme.title: Southern Bluefin Tuna Epic
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 South Seas Spearo S2 - "Southern Bluefin Tuna Epic"
programme.desc: After hearing reports of massive schools of southern bluefin tuna out of Milford Sound, Tim, Jordy, Kieran, Sam and Dave saddle up and try their luck, but a gear malfunction right in the heat of the moment threatens to seriously burst their bubble.

programme.title: Bay of Islands Exploration
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 South Seas Spearo S2 - "Bay of Islands Exploration"
programme.desc: The fellas set off to tick a box for rookie spearo Ants, aiming to bag him his first ever kingfish, before shifting focus to landing a few more prized fish in some stunning Bay of Islands blue water, but as it doesn't all go according to plan!

programme.title: Day Two Pt.2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Madfin Shark Series S1 - "Day Two Pt.2"
programme.desc: Day two & the battle continues on the Madfin Shark Series. Four of our 2-man teams are catching & releasing the biggest & most dangerous sharks they can for the most points they can accrue. After today, one team will be sent home & eliminated.

programme.title: Day Three Pt. 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Madfin Shark Series S1 - "Day Three Pt. 1"
programme.desc: It's the third and final day of competition for the remaining 3 teams in this intense shark tournament. See how the first half of the day turns out.

programme.title: Day Three Pt.2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Madfin Shark Series S1 - "Day Three Pt.2"
programme.desc: Day three continues at Hurricane Hole Marina in Key West, FL. Our three remaining 2-man teams are doing everything they can to find, catch & release the biggest sharks they can for points with only one goal in mind, bring home the trophy & the title.

programme.title: Surviving a Lightning Strike
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Lightning Strike"
programme.desc: Laura and Nick travel to a state-of-the-art Direct Effects Lightning Test Lab. With some “explosive” experiments, they’ll determine the power lightning and how it behaves? And they’ll find out how can hunters and fishermen best protect themselves?

programme.title: Surviving Nature’s Fury – Storms
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Survival Science S1 - "Surviving Nature’s Fury – Storms"
programme.desc: Nick and Laura experience Nature’s fury through storm amazing generating gear that simulates terrible hurricanes, ice cold winds and even tornados. For these experiments they’ll use remarkable technology that creates massive storms on Hollywood sets.

programme.title: Surviving a Mountain Lion Attack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Mountain Lion Attack"
programme.desc: Laura and Nick explore the techniques to deal with these apex predators when they are the most dangerous. We’ll scientifically breakdown the behaviors, strength, eyesight and speed of mountain lions through outrageous experiments, in day and night.

programme.title: The Broads

programme.desc: Thom hunt is challenged to hunt the mighty Pike in the Uk’s Norfolk Broads.

programme.title: UK

programme.desc: Laramy and 7 leave camp Hell Hole and hit the trail again. They are headed for lower elevation in search of a more permanent place to call home.

programme.sub-title: S06 : E05 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: The brokers explore Central America to find real estate options that fit the bill for two buyers looking for a change of scene.

programme.desc: Since working from home has become increasingly popular, Paul and Sonia are entertaining the idea of living and working abroad.
