programme.desc: Cody is with Lexi Limitless in the ‘Big Easy’ to explore New Orleans, visiting an abandoned Charity Hospital before meeting Brutus, the giant alligator.

programme.title: Yerevan
programme.desc: Josh goes local exploring in Armenia and its capital Yerevan, visiting some amazing abandoned Soviet buildings, a knitting factory and a luxurious hotel.

programme.title: Gary, Indiana
programme.sub-title: S02 : E14 Epic Exploring S2 - "Gary, Indiana"
programme.desc: Josh is back in Gary, Indiana, for a local exploring adventure. With friends, he visits a former bank, the memorial auditorium and Union Train Station.

programme.title: The Honeymoon is Over
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Love On The Rocks S1 - "The Honeymoon is Over"
programme.desc: Tayler and Jason take on their final peak in Washington State, Mt Baker. Tayler struggles when Jason explains all the things that could go wrong, but the reality is a lot could fail if they don't come together as a team.

programme.title: Best of ep. 1 to 5
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Running the World S1 - "Best of ep. 1 to 5"
programme.desc: Parkour athletes Max & Benj Cave look back over their travels so far and discuss the best places for practising parkour.

programme.title: Te Matau-a-Māui
programme.sub-title: S06 : E05 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Te Matau-a-Māui"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Māori All Black Shannon Paku are in Te Matau-a-Māui (Hawkes Bay). They’re hosted by Rob Beard of Beard Brothers Sausages, targeting Koura and Gurnard. They also visit Piri’s old stomping grounds of Te Aute College with ex-classmate Tautoko Ratu.

programme.title: Whakatāne
programme.sub-title: S06 : E06 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Whakatāne"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Crusader Tu Umaga-Marshall are in Whakatane. Hosted by Henare Ruru and Henare Rangitaawa of The Dive Squad, they target Haku (Kingfish), give tips and tricks to the Taneatua and Paroa Rugby Clubs and go on a Boar hunt with Troy Petersen.

programme.title: Waikawa
programme.sub-title: S06 : E07 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Waikawa"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Warrior Paul Whatuira are in Waikawa (Picton), diving and gathering kai for the local Kaumatua, trying for a day time Tuna (Eel) with Shannon’s son Malone and having a run around at the Motueka Rugby Club.

programme.title: Te Whanganui-a-Tara
programme.sub-title: S06 : E08 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Te Whanganui-a-Tara"
programme.desc: Piri is joined in his hometown of Wellington by ex Warrior Shontayne Hape, hosting his tamariki and taking them out for a dive and fish targeting the kids favourite - Kina! They also try their hands out at axe throwing at Sweet Axe Wellington.

programme.title: Cape Breton Island, Canada
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Cape Breton Island, Canada"
programme.desc: By pick-up truck, the brothers route is the culturally and geographically rich island of Cape Breton and the Cabot Trail. Lobster fishing, hooking, moose sightings, Bingo, Scottish ceilidhs, Mi'kmaq drum session, it's all happening in this episode.

programme.title: Volcan Madera, Nicaragua
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Volcan Madera, Nicaragua"
programme.desc: The brothers attain their goal of riding motorcycles to the heart of Nicaragua, through the jungle to the isolated beaches of the Pacific coast and back inland: through Spanish-colonial towns, local villages and the huge volcanic island of Ometepe.

programme.title: Yorkshire Dales, England
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Yorkshire Dales, England"
programme.desc: Imagine a 26-pub, 7-day, 60-mile pub-crawl! Doing a traditional ‘ramble’ through the stunning Yorkshire Dales region of northern England, the brother’s stride through the moors and dales and peaks and valleys - legs and livers intact.

programme.title: Te Matau-a-Māui
programme.sub-title: S06 : E05 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Te Matau-a-Māui"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Māori All Black Shannon Paku are in Te Matau-a-Māui (Hawkes Bay). They’re hosted by Rob Beard of Beard Brothers Sausages, targeting Koura and Gurnard. They also visit Piri’s old stomping grounds of Te Aute College with ex-classmate Tautoko Ratu.

programme.title: Whakatāne
programme.sub-title: S06 : E06 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Whakatāne"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Crusader Tu Umaga-Marshall are in Whakatane. Hosted by Henare Ruru and Henare Rangitaawa of The Dive Squad, they target Haku (Kingfish), give tips and tricks to the Taneatua and Paroa Rugby Clubs and go on a Boar hunt with Troy Petersen.

programme.title: Waikawa
programme.sub-title: S06 : E07 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Waikawa"
programme.desc: Piri and ex Warrior Paul Whatuira are in Waikawa (Picton), diving and gathering kai for the local Kaumatua, trying for a day time Tuna (Eel) with Shannon’s son Malone and having a run around at the Motueka Rugby Club.

programme.title: Te Whanganui-a-Tara
programme.sub-title: S06 : E08 Piri’s Tiki Tour S6 - "Te Whanganui-a-Tara"
programme.desc: Piri is joined in his hometown of Wellington by ex Warrior Shontayne Hape, hosting his tamariki and taking them out for a dive and fish targeting the kids favourite - Kina! They also try their hands out at axe throwing at Sweet Axe Wellington.

programme.title: Athens
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Street Art Challenge S1 - "Athens"
programme.desc: Two American street artists try to turn a school into a piece of art. Seems impossible, but this duo turns out to be a real American Dream Team.

programme.title: Bangalore
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Street Art Challenge S1 - "Bangalore"
programme.desc: Two worlds collide in one of the busiest cities in the world when Mexico’s most famous street artist is meeting his equivalent on their home turf in India.

programme.title: Berlin
programme.desc: DJ and house music producer Carly Foxx journeys Berlin, one of the worlds undisputed techno capitals, and discovers the sound of freedom buried in its history.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Streets S1 - "Las Vegas"
programme.desc: Las Vegas is home to a hot rod car club community which over the decades has been connected to the rise of rockabilly music. Through Luke Metz and his band, Shanda & The Howlers, we learn how this bond between fashion, music and cars was created.

programme.title: New York City
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Blindspots S1 - "New York City"
programme.desc: How does the bustling island of steel and stone fare for those with disabilities? James sets out to discover what it's like to travel blind in the Big Apple.

programme.title: London
programme.desc: James heads across the pond to discover what life for a blind traveler is like in a world capital like London.

programme.title: United Kingdom
programme.desc: Escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city, James takes the train to visit the rest of England - proving the rest of England is more accessible than one might think.

programme.title: Ireland
programme.desc: Marilia's Irish journey, meeting land enthusiasts, explored scenic spots, encounters with Ellie and Hazel, vegan delights at Cornucopia, and concluded with a reflective sunset in the Wicklow Mountains, highlighting a strong community spirit.

programme.title: Bali
programme.desc: Marilia's Bali journey, focused on purification rituals, blended culture, healing, and adventure. From Tirta Empul's cleansing to exploring Ubud, embracing nature, and local traditions, she found serenity, capturing precious moments in her odyssey.

programme.title: Malaysia
programme.desc: Marilia explores social support at Kechara Soup Kitchen, tries Acroyoga, enjoys plant-based food at Nomad Urban Cafe, and visits Melawati Canine Sanctuary. Her experiences emphasize the importance of helping others and maintaining life balance.

programme.title: Tokyo, Japan
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Breaking Beyond S1 - "Tokyo, Japan"
programme.desc: Vegas Bboy Ronnie is traveling to Japan to visit Bboy Shigekix in his hometown Tokyo. Shigekix will take Ronnie on an exciting Journey to show the Japanese culture and it's unique style of breaking and hip-hop.

programme.title: Rotterdam, The Netherlands
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Breaking Beyond S1 - "Rotterdam, The Netherlands"
programme.desc: In the city of Rotterdam, three times world champion, Menno, hosts b-boy Junior from France. Both are considered legends. Menno takes Junior on a trip he will never forget and meet people who have all left their mark in the Dutch breaking community.

programme.title: NYC, USA
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Breaking Beyond S1 - "NYC, USA"
programme.desc: Four BC One World Final legends from our series, Ronnie, Neguin, Junior and Shigekix, are coming to NYC. These legends will meet some of the future legends taking part in this year’s world final and take them on a journey through hip hop history.

programme.title: Switzerland
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 A Simple Path S2 - "Switzerland"
programme.desc: Lugano, home of Morel, Oops Bar and The Warriors. To Basel for cheesy potatoes, DIY with Oli and Claudia, Pipoz, Portland Bowl, the president, creative concrete and wood and the Rock n' Rollers. Back to The Beast then love underground at Bern Moosweg

programme.title: Berlin
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 A Simple Path S2 - "Berlin"
programme.desc: Berlin beautiful grunge, skate spoons, freestyle analogue,Griefswalder DIY and Skatesencia. Sketistan HQ, positive impact for kids the world over, NBU home of Hera, a space for expression. Place magazine, potato pants album cover prints and Templehof

programme.title: New York
programme.sub-title: S03 : E01 A Simple Path S3 - "New York"
programme.desc: Yann Horowitz delves into NYC's skate scene, visiting shops, meeting legends, and exploring iconic spots. He highlights skateboarding's community and inclusivity, expressing affection for the city and the connections forged through his passion.

programme.title: Maui
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Chasing Monsters: El Nino S1 - "Maui"
programme.desc: Tyler Larronde beats the odds to execute a seamless barrel at the legendary big wave known as Mavericks.

programme.title: Family Values
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Chasing Monsters: El Nino S1 - "Family Values"
programme.desc: A new generation of female chargers band together to compete in a unique big wave surfing ‘expression session’ on the north shore of Oahu.

programme.title: Skullbase
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Chasing Monsters: El Nino S1 - "Skullbase"
programme.desc: The Walsh twins reveal why water safety crews and rescue teams are the unsung heroes of big wave surfing.

programme.title: A Simple Path: The Worldwide Ride
programme.desc: Skateboarding and its do it yourself lifestyle has permeated into the worlds of art, music, and fashion. The constant progression and search for the new, attracts unique individuals from all walks of life.

programme.title: Garden Route
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Journey Within S1 - "Garden Route"
programme.desc: Marilia’s journey on South Africa's Garden Route explores plant medicine, beauty in nature, and animal communication, emphasizing the profound connection between humans and the natural world.

programme.title: Backpacking Québec – Part 1
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Epic Trails S3 - "Backpacking Québec – Part 1"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson explores epic coastal hiking routes of Gaspésie and the incredible nighttime wilderness adventures in the Eastern Township of Québec.

programme.title: Backpacking Québec – Part 2
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Epic Trails S3 - "Backpacking Québec – Part 2"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson backpacks along the spectacular Saguenay Fjord, before setting out on a paddling adventure in Québec’s Laurentian mountains.

programme.title: Polar Bears
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Travel Quest S2 - "Polar Bears"
programme.desc: There is one place in the world where the mighty polar bear—largest carnivore on earth—can be found in large numbers during a very specific time of the year…Churchill Manitoba, Canada.

programme.title: Namibia
programme.desc: Bill has a dual quest—the first to visit one of the greatest deserts in the world and find out how the creatures and plants survive. The other is a bit unorthodox and maybe unbelievable – he’s going to seek, and hopefully find, the mythical unicorn.

programme.title: Goma, Congo
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Breaking Beyond S1 - "Goma, Congo"
programme.desc: Bboy Junior is going back where he was born, The Democratic Republic of Congo. World champion Shigekix will join him, visiting Africa for the first time. Together they will explore the dance culture in the city of Goma.

programme.title: Sao Paulo, Brazil
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Breaking Beyond S1 - "Sao Paulo, Brazil"
programme.desc: Russian Bgirl Kastet is visiting Sao Paulo, the home of Bboy Neguin. Together they will explore the dance, breaking and hip hop culture in the streets of Sao Paulo. Meeting up with legends and learning Capoeira, Jiu Jitsu and Passinho.

programme.title: Las Vegas, USA
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Breaking Beyond S1 - "Las Vegas, USA"
programme.desc: Brazilian Bboy Neguin is visiting his friend Bboy Ronnie in his hometown Las Vegas. Ronnie istaking Neguin to meet all the different artists and dancers who are able to make a living inVegas by doing what they love most: performing on stage.

programme.title: Backpacking Québec – Part 1
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Epic Trails S3 - "Backpacking Québec – Part 1"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson explores epic coastal hiking routes of Gaspésie and the incredible nighttime wilderness adventures in the Eastern Township of Québec.

programme.title: Backpacking Québec – Part 2
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Epic Trails S3 - "Backpacking Québec – Part 2"
programme.desc: Eric Hanson backpacks along the spectacular Saguenay Fjord, before setting out on a paddling adventure in Québec’s Laurentian mountains.

programme.title: Polar Bears
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Travel Quest S2 - "Polar Bears"
programme.desc: There is one place in the world where the mighty polar bear—largest carnivore on earth—can be found in large numbers during a very specific time of the year…Churchill Manitoba, Canada.

programme.title: Namibia
programme.desc: Bill has a dual quest—the first to visit one of the greatest deserts in the world and find out how the creatures and plants survive. The other is a bit unorthodox and maybe unbelievable – he’s going to seek, and hopefully find, the mythical unicorn.

programme.title: Condo
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Top Million Dollar Agent S1 - "Condo"
programme.desc: Downsizing can be a difficult transition & Jin’s objective is to make it as seamless as possible. In this episode, Jin’s client is moving from a house in Port Credit to a luxurious condo close to the downtown core.

programme.title: King’s Obsession
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Top Million Dollar Agent S1 - "King’s Obsession"
programme.desc: It is time to upsize! Daryl’s client is moving away from downtown Toronto because they desire a bigger space, more privacy, & tranquility.

programme.title: Hong Kong - Michelin Madness part 1
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Hong Kong - Michelin Madness part 1"
programme.desc: Big money, big city vibes; Hong Kong houses the world’s highest number of millionaires and it’s something that’s not lost on you as you venture to Asia’s world city. In this episode, Sashi is on a quest to understand how Michelin rates and assesses the sheer depth of eateries in this metropolis. He will meet the top chefs of the city and understand their psyche, their trials and tribulations as they climbed their way to the top of the restaurant industry with 3 Michelin stars. But it's not all high brow cuisine, Sashi will also dive deep into the old school neighborhoods, sampling the local fare and seek out how Michelin is rating Asia’s sheer depth of eateries

programme.title: Hong Kong - Michelin Madness part 2
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Hong Kong - Michelin Madness part 2"
programme.desc: Big money, big city vibes; Hong Kong houses the world’s highest number of millionaires and it’s something that’s not lost on you as you venture to Asia’s world city. In this episode, Sashi is on a quest to understand how Michelin rates and assesses the sheer depth of eateries in this metropolis. He will meet the top chefs of the city and understand their psyche, their trials and tribulations as they climbed their way to the top of the restaurant industry with 3 Michelin stars. But it's not all high brow cuisine, Sashi will also dive deep into the old school neighborhoods, sampling the local fare and seek out how Michelin is rating Asia’s sheer depth of eateries.

programme.title: Layla Kerley & Bruno Compagnet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Capturing Winter S1 - "Layla Kerley & Bruno Compagnet"
programme.desc: Layla Kerley is a self-taught adventure photographer and one of the few females in her field. Together with Bruno Compagnet, co-founder of freeski brand Blackcrows, they plan to traverse one of the last wildernesses in Europe: the Italian Dolomites.

programme.title: Tristan 'Shu' Lebeschu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Capturing Winter S1 - "Tristan 'Shu' Lebeschu"
programme.desc: Renowned winter photographer, Tristan Shu, attempts his dream project; a photograph that combines astrophotography with action sports. His aim is to capture ski and snowboard tricks at night, set against the Milky-way and the spectacular Mont-Blanc.

programme.title: Jamaica
programme.desc: Easy island vibes, lots of amazing local rum, brilliant natural landscapes and those amazing beaches! Of course,Luxe Travels is in Jamaica! But in this episode, host Liesel Hlista shows you a different side of the Irie nation; away from the hordes of people unleashed via cruise liners!

programme.title: Bali - The Hidden Side part 1
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Bali - The Hidden Side part 1"
programme.desc: Indonesia is home to thousands of islands and exotic ingredients. But the most famous one is without a doubt, Bali. Known as a respite for travelers seeking health retreats, luxury villas, and lush tropical getaway experiences, Bali is without a doubt one of the most frequented island destinations. But there is a hidden side to it that is seeded in culture, mystery and traces of the grand splendor of Bali’s ancient kingdom legacy. To help him explore this, Sashi meets up with Reynaldo De Luna, the executive chef at the legendary Amandari. With Rey’s guidance, Sashi gets a first hand look at ancient temple ceremonies, foraging in the true wilds of Bali seeking out cashew, cloves, vanilla,...

programme.title: Bali - The Hidden Side part 2
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Bali - The Hidden Side part 2"
programme.desc: Indonesia is home to thousands of islands and exotic ingredients. But the most famous one is without a doubt, Bali. Known as a respite for travelers seeking health retreats, luxury villas, and lush tropical getaway experiences, Bali is without a doubt one of the most frequented island destinations. But there is a hidden side to it that is seeded in culture, mystery and traces of the grand splendor of Bali’s ancient kingdom legacy. To help him explore this, Sashi meets up with Reynaldo De Luna, the executive chef at the legendary Amandari. With Rey’s guidance, Sashi gets a first hand look at ancient temple ceremonies, foraging in the true wilds of Bali seeking out cashew, cloves, vanilla,...

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: From the local delicacies of Beijing's Ox Street to latest hangouts and contemporary cuisine of the Chinese capital, hosts Tianran He and Eva May will give you a true taste of Beijing, and the fascinating stories and people behind them.

programme.title: Beijing's Hutons
programme.desc: The Hutongs in Beijing are considered the city's blood vessels, as these traditional alleyways make up the DNA of the capital for its rich history and culture.

programme.title: Finland
programme.desc: Finland is that one Nordic country that is never on the global cuisine radar. However, the reserved Finns have been quietly perfecting their craft of foraging culture and incorporating it into their unique cuisine. Jonathan Legg explores the entire expanse of the country to understand it’s cuisine, and the ethos of the country’s top chefs; from amazing locally sourced cuisine in Helsinki, to an expedition in Lapland to learn about foraging and the Finnish delicacy, reindeer!

programme.title: Ireland
programme.desc: It’s the birthplace of Halloween, but the ghosts and ghouls which have canvassed the world have not scared up much interest in Irish cuisine. Mounting a classic motorcycle Jonathan tours a land of mystic traditions, boisterous locals, and iconic scenery. The world’s most magnetic pub culture draws him in, border conflict pushes him out, and dark legends pull him around. It’s an adventure soaked in rain, lore, and the food of ancestor’s past.

programme.title: Russia
programme.desc: Jonathan faces his toughest challenge yet as he enters a country that has been coming to grips in defining and understanding their own cuisine. Through the historical turmoil and harsh climate, Russia has lost it’s traditional way of cooking, and eating. But the country is reviving this culture; Jonathan ventures the far stretches of the country to learn about modern cooks, as well as ancient kitchens housing the one key tool that gave birth to true Russian cuisine, the Russian oven. He’ll learn their insights, understand their efforts, and work with traditional Russian ingredients to learn what the cuisine used to be, and where it’s headed today.

programme.title: Frédéric Molina – Moulin de Léré
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Taste of France S1 - "Frédéric Molina – Moulin de Léré"
programme.desc: At the feet of the Jura mountains,”close to nature” chef Fredric Molina built up an ideal family restaurant and earned his first Michelin star. Let’s explore the secrets to his delicious food, his way of building a power team and how he finds harmony

programme.title: René & Maxime Meilleur – La Bouitte
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Taste of France S1 - "René & Maxime Meilleur – La Bouitte"
programme.desc: In this program we’ll get acquainted with the unique story of self-taught René and Maxime Meilleur, father and son running a three-star Michelin restaurant in Saint-Martin-de-Belleville in the Savoy region.

programme.title: Alexandre Mazzia – AM
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Taste of France S1 - "Alexandre Mazzia – AM"
programme.desc: In this program we’ll meet two Michelin star chef, Alexandre Mazzia at his highly acclaimed restaurant in Marseilles. His daily challenge is not lack of inspiration, but to filter the massive influx of ideas that runs through his head.

programme.title: Qingdao
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He and Eva May venture to Qingdao, China's beer mecca by the sea. With red tiles and green trees that make up the city's stunning scenery, our hosts embark on another foodie-journey with local delicacies and special guests.

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Join our hosts Tianran He and Eva May as they explore the boisterous event of Wuzhen's International Theatre festival, with colorful features of both theatrical and culinary nature.

programme.title: Eating Global in Beijing
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Foodwise S1 - "Eating Global in Beijing"
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He and Eva May are in search of global cuisines that can be found in Beijing, the 3000-year old capital of China. From honest farm-to-table fare, to the culinary heights of French haute cuisine, and even a cooking class.

programme.title: Philippines - More fun in the Philippines part 1
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Philippines - More fun in the Philippines part 1"
programme.desc: The story of cacao is more akin to South America, but in this episode, Sashi tracks the story of cacao in the Philippines, the entry point of cacao in Asia. With his friend, Spanish chef, Chele Gonzalez, they embark on an anthropological exploration tracing how the ancestral varietal cacao (crillio) came to be in the Philippine islands. Visiting farms to mystical islands, to top kitchens in Manila, this is the ‘never-before-told’ tale of cacao in the Philippine islands.

programme.title: Philippines - More fun in the Philippines part 2
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Philippines - More fun in the Philippines part 2"
programme.desc: The story of cacao is more akin to South America, but in this episode, Sashi tracks the story of cacao in the Philippines, the entry point of cacao in Asia. With his friend, Spanish chef, Chele Gonzalez, they embark on an anthropological exploration tracing how the ancestral varietal cacao (crillio) came to be in the Philippine islands. Visiting farms to mystical islands, to top kitchens in Manila, this is the ‘never-before-told’ tale of cacao in the Philippine islands.

programme.title: Vietnam - Heart of Hanoi part 1
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Vietnam - Heart of Hanoi part 1"
programme.desc: Vietnam offers travelers a wide range of exotic as well as simple homegrown grub. Sashi rolls into town with no knowledge of Vietnamese cuisine, and he gets an indepth street food 101 tour of the city. From learning about haute Franco-Vietnamese cuisine with the city’s best French chefs, to a simple and honest bowl of pho. In this episode, Sashi uncovers the bustling city of Hanoi and all its trappings. Secret alleyways leading to decades old cafes offering famous brews like egg coffee; to iconic places that serve French style baguettes and everything in between!

programme.title: Mexico
programme.desc: Jonathan Legg is from California and he thinks he knows Mexican cuisine. This notion gets shattered as he experiences the onslaught of food in Mexico city! Between trying scorpion tacos and dodging shady markets in San Juan, he learns the dark art of sacred drinks, like pulque and mezcal, now turned into social libations. His journey also takes him to Oaxaca where he gets the low down on the fabled Mole sauce, and a long haul to a remote village reveals a secret ceremony that has origins of dark arts!

programme.title: Nut
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Paradise Kitchen Bali S1 - "Nut"
programme.desc: Join Lauren on a culinary adventure with various nuts as she discovers their potential beyond snacking and incorporates them into Italian and Balinese recipes like Cashew cheese, mouthwatering Cabonara and more delightful flavors.

programme.title: Belize
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Delinquent Gourmet S1 - "Belize"
programme.desc: Gord is in Dangriga, Belize to explore the country's unique melting pot of African, Spanish and Caribbean cuisines. Taking to the streets, he tastes the wares of vendor after vendor - Johnnycakes, tamales, garnaches - Belize's heavenly taco. And then at the Dangriga market, our Delinquent Gourmet discovers varieties of fish he's never even heard of!

programme.title: Portugal
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Delinquent Gourmet S1 - "Portugal"
programme.desc: Rodney is in Porto, Portugal. And although he's not yet a huge fan of Portuguese food, he's here to see if this seaside city can inspire him to change his mind. After watching the fishermen haul in their catch, Rodney cooks up lunch for one of the fishermen and his wife.

programme.title: The Street Scene
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Streetfood Nomad: Kolkata S1 - "The Street Scene"
programme.desc: Kolkata’s extraordinary street-food scene has been influenced by its various conquerors and rulers. The most profound influence has been from the fabulously rich and powerful Mughals. Will reimagines classic dishes while also incorporating the unique street food flavours he encounters.

programme.title: Fuelling the Workforce
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Streetfood Nomad: Kolkata S1 - "Fuelling the Workforce"
programme.desc: The city of Kolkata is one of the most densely populated in the world. That’s a lot of mouths to feed. Fortunately, it’s a place that knows just how to do it. Fuelled by the bustling energy of street vendors, Will seeks inspiration from Indian working man's essentials.

programme.title: Port Lincoln, SA
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Khanh Ong's Wild Food S1 - "Port Lincoln, SA"
programme.desc: Chef Khanh Ong Journeys to the rugged coastal town of Port Lincoln, in South Australia to unlock the secrets of the local seafood. From locals, he learns how to trawl for wild prawns, harvest oysters and forages for unique coastal ingredients.

programme.title: Quanzhou
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He and Eva May are in Quanzhou, the ancient starting point of the Maritime Silk Road. From its covered arcades and Roman columns to its Southeast Asian vibe, our hosts discover that Quanzhou truly is a melting pot of cultures

programme.title: Xi'an
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He and Eva May venture to Xi'an, an ancient city with over 3000 years of history, capital to 13 Chinese dynasties. But first, our hosts are going to carb load on street food, from glutinous rice cakes.

programme.title: Datong
programme.desc: Tianran He and Angela Fu are in historic Datong. Located in northern China's Shanxi Province, some 1500 years ago Datong was the capital of the Northern Wei Dynasty, which saw nomads unite northern China and Buddhism spread throughout the country.

programme.title: Belize
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Delinquent Gourmet S1 - "Belize"
programme.desc: Gord is in Dangriga, Belize to explore the country's unique melting pot of African, Spanish and Caribbean cuisines. Taking to the streets, he tastes the wares of vendor after vendor - Johnnycakes, tamales, garnaches - Belize's heavenly taco. And then at the Dangriga market, our Delinquent Gourmet discovers varieties of fish he's never even heard of!

programme.title: Portugal
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Delinquent Gourmet S1 - "Portugal"
programme.desc: Rodney is in Porto, Portugal. And although he's not yet a huge fan of Portuguese food, he's here to see if this seaside city can inspire him to change his mind. After watching the fishermen haul in their catch, Rodney cooks up lunch for one of the fishermen and his wife.

programme.title: The Street Scene
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Streetfood Nomad: Kolkata S1 - "The Street Scene"
programme.desc: Kolkata’s extraordinary street-food scene has been influenced by its various conquerors and rulers. The most profound influence has been from the fabulously rich and powerful Mughals. Will reimagines classic dishes while also incorporating the unique street food flavours he encounters.

programme.title: Kesi
programme.desc: Silk is a classic symbol of Chinese culture. It helped opened up economic and cultural exchanges between East and West and witnessed the spread of Eastern civilization to the world. As a representative of traditional Chinese silk art, kesi is renowned for its highly ornamental weaving techniques of highlighting warps and breaking wefts, and has been deeply loved by people for thousands of years. In folk culture, it enjoys the reputation of “an inch of kesi is worth an inch of gold.”

programme.title: China Untapped: Changsha
programme.desc: The city of Changsha is one of central China's powerhouses. It's a leader in both the construction machinery industry and in media – Changsha was China's first UNESCO "Creative City". It's also one of China's best-known cities for its nightlife. The soul of a city is in its people, and this episode focuses on the women of Changsha who are helping to innovate, change and further develop this city they call home.

programme.title: China Untapped: Changsha

The soul of a city is in its people, and this episode focuses on the women of Changsha who are helping to innovate, change and further develop this city they call home.

programme.title: China Untapped: Huzhou
programme.desc: Located in the east of China, on the south shore of Taihu Lake, Huzhou has been well-known for its richness in resources and blooming in silk trade since the ancient times. Guided by the concept of "lucid waters and lush mountains are invaluable assets", Huzhou now is committed to developing green industries. In this episode, CGTN hosts Tianran He and Hannah Wilson travelled to Huzhou, where they tried a variety of guesthouse hotels in the Moganshan Mountains; experienced the life of digital nomads in Anji’s countryside; learned about the eco-concepts behind China's traditional architectures in Nanxun Ancient Town; and explored the development of eco-agriculture powered by high-tech along...

programme.title: China Bound：Xiamen
programme.desc: What's it like in one of China's happiest cities? Tianran is in sunny Xiamen on China's southeast coast, visiting the city's famous "island of music" and sampling local delicacies like shark meatballs, shacha noodles and fish in "soy sauce water". He'll discover former fishing villages turned hipster havens, drink tea with locals beneath traditional tenement buildings, and visit a student enclave brimming with creative startup energy.

programme.title: China Bound：Xiamen
programme.desc: What's it like in one of China's happiest cities? Tianran is in sunny Xiamen on China's southeast coast, visiting the city's famous "island of music" and sampling local delicacies like shark meatballs, shacha noodles and fish in "soy sauce water". He'll discover former fishing villages turned hipster havens, drink tea with locals beneath traditional tenement buildings, and visit a student enclave brimming with creative startup energy.

programme.title: China Bound：Suzhou
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He visits Suzhou, a historic city in eastern China famously admired by Marco Polo. Crisscrossed by canals, Suzhou is renowned for its exquisite gardens, where ancient scholars recreated nature's beauty within their own homes. Tianran discovers a city of refined tastes, where even a bowl of breakfast noodles comes with unspoken etiquette, locals insist on only in-season produce, and foodies eagerly await the arrival of prized hairy crabs.

programme.title: China Bound：Suzhou

programme.title: China Bound: Chengdu
programme.desc: Tianran spends 3 days in Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan Province and UNESCO's first City of Gastronomy. He dives deep into Chengdu culture, exploring the infamous "mala" numbing and spicy flavors of Sichuanese street food and hotpot, and visiting historical attractions like Wuhou Shrine, Du Fu's Thatched Cottage, and the Jinsha Site Museum, which houses exquisite relics from a 3,000-year-old kingdom uncovered beneath the streets of Chengdu. Of course, no visit to this city is complete without seeing giant pandas and enjoying a cup of tea while getting your ears cleaned in the iconic People's Park. After all, when in Chengdu, do as the locals do.

programme.title: Seafaring Tales: Fu Ships
programme.desc: In past centuries, transporting goods along the Maritime Silk Road could be a hazardous undertaking. Ships often faced fierce storms which blew up on the high seas. To reduce the danger, China’s shipbuilders came up with a solution. They developed Fu ships, commonly known as junks, incorporating a special watertight bulkhead technology. Their revolutionary design allowed the ships to withstand the highest winds and roughest waters.The Maritime Silk Road was an ancient trading route that connected China to Southeast and South Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. As a key passageway for trade and cultural exchange, it thrived for well over a thousand years, bringing Chinese tea, silk,...

programme.title: Huayin Old Tunes: the Earliest Rock and Roll by the Yellow River
programme.desc: Huayin Laoqiang is the name given to a traditional form of shadow puppet show. It translates as “Huayin Old Tunes,” and originated in the chanting of the boatmen working at the confluence of the Yellow, Weihe, and Luohe Rivers, close to the city of Huayin in Shaanxi Province. This chanting evolved into folk songs which, with time, were illustrated with puppet shows. The loud music, rustic instruments, and enthusiastic performances epitomize the way the local people lead their lives.

programme.title: Awakening Lion
programme.desc: Xingshi, or literally “awakened lion,” is a name for the southern style of the lion dance. Historically, it evolved from a court dance in the Tang Dynasty almost 1,200 years ago. With the southward migration of the population from the central plains, lion dance culture was introduced to the south. In the Ming Dynasty around 400 years ago, xingshi appeared in Guangdong and was then widely spread throughout southern China and even overseas. Lion dance has become a very important part of Chinese culture.

programme.title: Quanzhou Nanyin: A Living Fossil in the History of Chinese Music
programme.desc: Nanyin, also known as “Quanzhou Nanyin,” is an ancient Han Chinese musical tradition whose singing style preserves the time-honored ethnic vocal techniques predating the Tang Dynasty, earning it the title of “a living fossil in the history of Chinese music.”The program features Yegor, a Ukrainian music enthusiast, visiting Master Su Shuyong, a Nanyin inheritor, to hear her decades-long stories of teaching this art. They also tour the Quanzhou Nanyin Troupe, where, led by its artistic director Zhuang Lifen, they learn about the basic performance formats and instruments of Nanyin. Additionally, the episode follows a post-1990s Nanyin performer, Zheng Mingming, as she sips tea with guests...

programme.title: Quanzhou Puppet Theater: China’s "Pinocchio Adventure"
programme.desc: In the film, the puppet Pinocchio, carved and created by an old carpenter, comes to life as a real human. Puppets are lifeless by nature—it is the masterful skills of their puppeteers’ fingertips that breathe life into them. What does China’s own "Pinocchio Adventure" look like? This episode takes you into the world of Quanzhou String Puppet Theater. Explore behind-the-scenes stories, from the intricate carving of puppet heads to the art of puppet performance, and witness how the dance of ten fingers and threads weaves a thousand vivid characters to life!

Explore behind-the-scenes stories, from the intricate carving of puppet heads to the art of puppet performance, and witness how the dance of ten fingers and threads weaves a thousand vivid characters to life!

programme.desc: The city of Changsha is one of central China's powerhouses. It's a leader in both the construction machinery industry and in media – Changsha was China's first UNESCO "Creative City". It's also one of China's best-known cities for its nightlife. The soul of a city is in its people, and this episode focuses on the women of Changsha who are helping to innovate, change and further develop this city they call home.

programme.title: China Untapped: Huzhou
programme.desc: Located in the east of China, on the south shore of Taihu Lake, Huzhou has been well-known for its richness in resources and blooming in silk trade since the ancient times. Guided by the concept of "lucid waters and lush mountains are invaluable assets", Huzhou now is committed to developing green industries. In this episode, CGTN hosts Tianran He and Hannah Wilson travelled to Huzhou, where they tried a variety of guesthouse hotels in the Moganshan Mountains; experienced the life of digital nomads in Anji’s countryside; learned about the eco-concepts behind China's traditional architectures in Nanxun Ancient Town; and explored the development of eco-agriculture powered by high-tech along...

Tianran is in sunny Xiamen on China's southeast coast, visiting the city's famous "island of music" and sampling local delicacies like shark meatballs, shacha noodles and fish in "soy sauce water". He'll discover former fishing villages turned hipster havens, drink tea with locals beneath traditional tenement buildings, and visit a student enclave brimming with creative startup energy.

programme.title: China Bound：Suzhou
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He visits Suzhou, a historic city in eastern China famously admired by Marco Polo. Crisscrossed by canals, Suzhou is renowned for its exquisite gardens, where ancient scholars recreated nature's beauty within their own homes. Tianran discovers a city of refined tastes, where even a bowl of breakfast noodles comes with unspoken etiquette, locals insist on only in-season produce, and foodies eagerly await the arrival of prized hairy crabs.

programme.title: China Bound: Chengdu
programme.desc: Tianran spends 3 days in Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan Province and UNESCO's first City of Gastronomy. He dives deep into Chengdu culture, exploring the infamous "mala" numbing and spicy flavors of Sichuanese street food and hotpot, and visiting historical attractions like Wuhou Shrine, Du Fu's Thatched Cottage, and the Jinsha Site Museum, which houses exquisite relics from a 3,000-year-old kingdom uncovered beneath the streets of Chengdu. Of course, no visit to this city is complete without seeing giant pandas and enjoying a cup of tea while getting your ears cleaned in the iconic People's Park. After all, when in Chengdu, do as the locals do.

programme.title: Seafaring Tales: Fu Ships
programme.desc: In past centuries, transporting goods along the Maritime Silk Road could be a hazardous undertaking. Ships often faced fierce storms which blew up on the high seas. To reduce the danger, China’s shipbuilders came up with a solution. They developed Fu ships, commonly known as junks, incorporating a special watertight bulkhead technology. Their revolutionary design allowed the ships to withstand the highest winds and roughest waters.The Maritime Silk Road was an ancient trading route that connected China to Southeast and South Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. As a key passageway for trade and cultural exchange, it thrived for well over a thousand years, bringing Chinese tea, silk,...

programme.title: Huayin Old Tunes: the Earliest Rock and Roll by the Yellow River
programme.desc: Huayin Laoqiang is the name given to a traditional form of shadow puppet show. It translates as “Huayin Old Tunes,” and originated in the chanting of the boatmen working at the confluence of the Yellow, Weihe, and Luohe Rivers, close to the city of Huayin in Shaanxi Province. This chanting evolved into folk songs which, with time, were illustrated with puppet shows. The loud music, rustic instruments, and enthusiastic performances epitomize the way the local people lead their lives.

programme.title: Awakening Lion
programme.desc: Xingshi, or literally “awakened lion,” is a name for the southern style of the lion dance. Historically, it evolved from a court dance in the Tang Dynasty almost 1,200 years ago. With the southward migration of the population from the central plains, lion dance culture was introduced to the south. In the Ming Dynasty around 400 years ago, xingshi appeared in Guangdong and was then widely spread throughout southern China and even overseas. Lion dance has become a very important part of Chinese culture.

programme.title: Quanzhou Nanyin: A Living Fossil in the History of Chinese Music
programme.desc: Nanyin, also known as “Quanzhou Nanyin,” is an ancient Han Chinese musical tradition whose singing style preserves the time-honored ethnic vocal techniques predating the Tang Dynasty, earning it the title of “a living fossil in the history of Chinese music.”The program features Yegor, a Ukrainian music enthusiast, visiting Master Su Shuyong, a Nanyin inheritor, to hear her decades-long stories of teaching this art. They also tour the Quanzhou Nanyin Troupe, where, led by its artistic director Zhuang Lifen, they learn about the basic performance formats and instruments of Nanyin. Additionally, the episode follows a post-1990s Nanyin performer, Zheng Mingming, as she sips tea with guests...

programme.title: Quanzhou Puppet Theater: China’s "Pinocchio Adventure"
programme.desc: In the film, the puppet Pinocchio, carved and created by an old carpenter, comes to life as a real human. Puppets are lifeless by nature—it is the masterful skills of their puppeteers’ fingertips that breathe life into them. What does China’s own "Pinocchio Adventure" look like? This episode takes you into the world of Quanzhou String Puppet Theater. Explore behind-the-scenes stories, from the intricate carving of puppet heads to the art of puppet performance, and witness how the dance of ten fingers and threads weaves a thousand vivid characters to life!

programme.title: China Bound: Chongqing
programme.desc: Join us in southwest China's Chongqing, one of the world's biggest cities. From futuristic skylines and cyberpunk streets, to fire-breathing opera, spicy hotpot and kungfu tea, we're diving deep into this megacity the size of Austria.

programme.title: China Bound: Guangzhou
programme.desc: Join us in Guangzhou, a global manufacturing hub in south China with a population as large as New York’s. From browsing hip street markets to wholesale clothes shopping, sampling world-famous Cantonese cuisine, and visiting the childhood home of kungfu legend Bruce Lee, there is plenty to do during our stay.

programme.title: China Bound: Guangzhou
programme.desc: Join us in Guangzhou, a global manufacturing hub in south China with a population as large as New York’s. From browsing hip street markets to wholesale clothes shopping, sampling world-famous Cantonese cuisine, and visiting the childhood home of kungfu legend Bruce Lee, there is plenty to do during our stay.

programme.title: China Bound: Wuhan
programme.desc: Tianran He visits Wuhan, a megacity at the crossroads of central China. From experiencing its vibrant breakfast culture and iconic dishes like hot dry noodles to exploring the lakes and hills of the expansive East Lake, as well as historic districts that showcase a blend of Chinese and Western architecture, Tianran uncovers why Wuhan has been a pivotal city in Chinese history for centuries. Finally, he relives some of these moments through immersive theater performances set amongst historic buildings and aboard a steamship cruising the Yangtze River.

programme.title: China Bound: Harbin
programme.desc: Tianran He is in Harbin, the "Ice City", host of the 2025 Asian Winter Games. Internationally renowned for its breathtaking ice and snow sculptures, the city thrives with activity despite it -20°C winters. From savoring the famous local ice cream and hearty northeastern Chinese dishes such as stewed goose and sweet-and-sour pork, to drifting on the frozen Songhua River and carving down the slopse of Yabuli Ski Resort, discover how much fun you can have in Harbin.

programme.title: From Stone to Story
programme.desc: China's profound stone carving culture dates back to the Han Dynasty (202 BC – 220 AD) and flourished during the Tang Dynasty (618 – 907 AD), evolving into a distinctive art form and unique cultural practice. Among many places famous for stone carving, Hui’an County—through generations of dedicated artisans—has risen to prominence and earned the esteemed title of "World Capital of Stone Carving," awarded by the World Crafts Council.The county’s skilled stonemasons are celebrated for their ability to transform ordinary pieces of rock into beautiful works of art. This episode shines a spotlight on the intangible cultural heritage of Hui’an stone carving and reveals how it has been...

programme.title: Rhythms of the Forest: A Sound of Li Instruments
programme.desc: Li bamboo and wood instruments offer a journey into the unique sounds of Hainan's Li ethnic group. Explore the ancient craftsmanship and musical heritage, from the resonant tones of bamboo flutes to the percussive rhythms of wooden drums. Experience the natural melodies that tell the stories of the Li people.

programme.title: Chengdu Lacquerware Art
programme.desc: Chengdu lacquerware is unique, thanks to its “three carvings and one engraving” technique. Along with its bold decorative style, this has made it a gem of Chinese lacquer art. Chengdu lacquerware also emphasizes the use of vibrant colors. Pieces are brought to beautiful life by bright red, vivid yellow, emerald green, and other striking hues.

programme.title: Chengdu Lacquerware Art

programme.title: Chengdu Lacquerware Art

programme.title: Miao Embroidery: History in Stitches
programme.desc: According to legend, during a migration by the Miao ethnic group, a female chieftain wanted to keep a record of all the mountains and lakes she passed along the way. The means she chose of doing so was by stitching the images on her dress. By the time they reached a suitable place to settle, her clothing was covered with embroidered designs. This, it’s said, was the origin of Miao embroidery. As the story tells us, the designs in Miao embroidery are closely related to the natural world and daily life. The Miao people have a special fondness for nature. So, as well as depicting their daily farming and work activities, they copy birds, flowers, mountains, and grass onto their clothing. Over...

programme.title: Miao Silverware: A Shining Epic
programme.desc: In this episode, we explore the fascinating world of the silver-working art of the Miao ethnic group. Join us, and hear the stories and see the works of four remarkable individuals. From a national-level inheritor who is preserving the traditional craft, to an artist infusing personal flair into his designs; from a female silversmith imbuing her work with feminine warmth, to a young artisan inspiring a new generation, we investigate the rich heritage, cultural significance, and evolving potential of Miao silverware.

This is Kungfu-wise.Kleber travels to Foshan, the birthplace of Wing Chun. A practitioner of this style, he seeks out masters of two different lineages: Ip Man and Snake...

programme.title: From Stone to Story
programme.desc: China's profound stone carving culture dates back to the Han Dynasty (202 BC – 220 AD) and flourished during the Tang Dynasty (618 – 907 AD), evolving into a distinctive art form and unique cultural practice. Among many places famous for stone carving, Hui’an County—through generations of dedicated artisans—has risen to prominence and earned the esteemed title of "World Capital of Stone Carving," awarded by the World Crafts Council.The county’s skilled stonemasons are celebrated for their ability to transform ordinary pieces of rock into beautiful works of art. This episode shines a spotlight on the intangible cultural heritage of Hui’an stone carving and reveals how it has been...

programme.title: Chengdu Lacquerware Art
programme.desc: Chengdu lacquerware is unique, thanks to its “three carvings and one engraving” technique. Along with its bold decorative style, this has made it a gem of Chinese lacquer art. Chengdu lacquerware also emphasizes the use of vibrant colors. Pieces are brought to beautiful life by bright red, vivid yellow, emerald green, and other striking hues.

programme.title: Miao Embroidery: History in Stitches
programme.desc: According to legend, during a migration by the Miao ethnic group, a female chieftain wanted to keep a record of all the mountains and lakes she passed along the way. The means she chose of doing so was by stitching the images on her dress. By the time they reached a suitable place to settle, her clothing was covered with embroidered designs. This, it’s said, was the origin of Miao embroidery. As the story tells us, the designs in Miao embroidery are closely related to the natural world and daily life. The Miao people have a special fondness for nature. So, as well as depicting their daily farming and work activities, they copy birds, flowers, mountains, and grass onto their clothing. Over...

programme.title: Miao Silverware: A Shining Epic
programme.desc: In this episode, we explore the fascinating world of the silver-working art of the Miao ethnic group. Join us, and hear the stories and see the works of four remarkable individuals. From a national-level inheritor who is preserving the traditional craft, to an artist infusing personal flair into his designs; from a female silversmith imbuing her work with feminine warmth, to a young artisan inspiring a new generation, we investigate the rich heritage, cultural significance, and evolving potential of Miao silverware.

programme.title: China Bound: Chongqing
programme.desc: Join us in southwest China's Chongqing, one of the world's biggest cities. From futuristic skylines and cyberpunk streets, to fire-breathing opera, spicy hotpot and kungfu tea, we're diving deep into this megacity the size of Austria.

programme.title: China Bound: Guangzhou
programme.desc: Join us in Guangzhou, a global manufacturing hub in south China with a population as large as New York’s. From browsing hip street markets to wholesale clothes shopping, sampling world-famous Cantonese cuisine, and visiting the childhood home of kungfu legend Bruce Lee, there is plenty to do during our stay.

programme.title: China Bound: Guangzhou
programme.desc: Join us in Guangzhou, a global manufacturing hub in south China with a population as large as New York’s. From browsing hip street markets to wholesale clothes shopping, sampling world-famous Cantonese cuisine, and visiting the childhood home of kungfu legend Bruce Lee, there is plenty to do during our stay.

programme.title: China Bound: Wuhan
programme.desc: Tianran He visits Wuhan, a megacity at the crossroads of central China. From experiencing its vibrant breakfast culture and iconic dishes like hot dry noodles to exploring the lakes and hills of the expansive East Lake, as well as historic districts that showcase a blend of Chinese and Western architecture, Tianran uncovers why Wuhan has been a pivotal city in Chinese history for centuries. Finally, he relives some of these moments through immersive theater performances set amongst historic buildings and aboard a steamship cruising the Yangtze River.

programme.title: China Bound: Harbin
programme.desc: Tianran He is in Harbin, the "Ice City", host of the 2025 Asian Winter Games. Internationally renowned for its breathtaking ice and snow sculptures, the city thrives with activity despite it -20°C winters. From savoring the famous local ice cream and hearty northeastern Chinese dishes such as stewed goose and sweet-and-sour pork, to drifting on the frozen Songhua River and carving down the slopse of Yabuli Ski Resort, discover how much fun you can have in Harbin.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut

Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. He learns how its blocks and strikes were inspired by animal movements, and how acupuncture points can be used to deadly effect. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. He learns how its blocks and strikes were inspired by animal movements, and how acupuncture points can be used to deadly effect. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Ding Porcelain Firing
programme.desc: In ancient times, skilled craftsmen combined clay with fire and, using nothing more than their hands and wisdom, created the history of porcelain.A thousand years ago, at the time of the Northern Song Dynasty, a type of porcelain was produced that stood out for its exquisite quality, elegant coloring and beautiful patterns. This was Ding porcelain, and it became a favorite at the imperial court. However, within 200 years, amid the chaos of constant warfare, the art of making it was lost. The dazzling white light of the Ding kilns had faded, seemingly forever. And yet, 800 years later, that light has been reignited.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving
programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving
programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Grand Song of the Dong — Natural Oriental Harmony
programme.desc: The Grand Song of the Dong is a polyphonic folk singing tradition of the Dong ethnic group. Performers from several villages gather together to sing, unaccompanied.The songs, which describe the history, beliefs, customs, and emotions of the Dong people, are an important part of their cultural identity and contribute significantly to their social cohesion.Generally sung in the Dong language, which has no written form, they are passed on orally from one generation to the next. Classified into various genres—including narrative and love songs, drinking and funeral songs—they are often accompanied by clapping, stomping, and dancing.Sung on occasions such as festivals, weddings, and...

programme.title: Exploring Ethnic Attire: Dong Elegance
programme.desc: Dong clothing weaves together tradition, craftsmanship, and the unique identity of the Dong ethnic group. In this episode, we’ll unravel the stories behind the intricate designs, vibrant colors, and deep cultural significance of Dong attire. From ceremonial garments to everyday wear, each piece is imbued with the essence of a rich heritage.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Destination Sardinia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Sardinia
programme.desc: The first stop on this journey to the land of happy, long life is the Ogliastra region of Sardinia. Here, almost one in five inhabitants is over 90 - 20 times more than in France! Yet this is a far cry from the Mediterranean diet recommended by nutritionists: meat and cholesterol galore. Even more astonishing, consanguinity is paradoxically conducive to the extreme longevity of the inhabitants... our wellness food specialist and a general practitioner will investigate these phenomena and meet nonagenarians and centenarians with exceptional stories.

programme.title: Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.desc: To better understand the role of these explosive mountains located all over the world, on land or under the sea, Yann Arthus-Bertrand goes to Italy, the country with the most active volcanoes in Europe. Accompanied by volcano expert Jacques-Marie Bardintzeff, the photographer meets those people who have chosen to live with « their » volcano, in spite of the dangers involved in this kind of proximity.

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and astonishing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We find ourselves in Kenya, where the biodiversity is particularly rich, in the Massaï Mara reserve. Then, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the worrying disappearance of hippos from Lake Edward has unexpected consequences for the survival of fishermen. Then, in the sanctuary of life, the Pantanal region in Brazil, where millions of animal and plant species are teeming, some of the world's great wetlands also in danger. In Tasmania, Yann Arthus-Bertrand fights against the napalm deforestation of one of the oldest and most beautiful forests...

programme.title: The flavors of flowers
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julie's Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The flavors of flowers
programme.desc: Eating flowers might appear unconventional, but we often consume them without even realizing it. Consider artichokes, for instance : they are essentially large, unopened flowers. Capers are the preserved buds of flowers soaked in vinegar, and cloves are dried flower buds. We also find courgette flowers, saffron pistils, orange blossom water used to flavor pastries, and the violet sweets that evoke memories of our childhood. In addition to adding aesthetic appeal and providing a dose of vitamins to our plates, flowers elevate the flavors of a dish and can even serve as a vegetable substitute.

programme.title: Hot Yoga Session
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Hot Yoga Session
programme.desc: Always on the look for looking for new detox discoveries, Val leads us to Lifehouse’s tonic and elixirs. Here, she discovers the range of elixir with therapeutic virtues exhilarating and relaxing. Before leaving, we made a hook by Jack's lab to prepare our own elixir. A private hot Yoga session then awaited Val at the popular Urban Exhale Hot Yoga where wearing a swimsuit could be welcomed. This episode ends on a fruity note as we tasted smoothies with unusual names that seduced Val, especially the 72 and Sun.

programme.title: Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.desc: Val gives an appointment to the singer Sinclair, for a floating session: a sensory deprivation technique in a bath. Then, we will discover an experience that is all the rage across the Atlantic, the Barre Shape! It's a class that mixes classical dance, yoga and cardio training. All this in a girly and boudoir atmosphere. After the effort comes comfort! We will meet a Superfood expert who will make us test and discover all the "Superfoods" that are very popular in California and that the whole healthy world is talking about.

programme.title: Collecting seeds
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Collecting seeds
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to save seeds. As you may have noticed, fruits, such as apples and lemons, contain seeds, but so do some of the vegetables you eat, such as peppers and tomatoes. This is because they are, in fact, fruits just like the apple and the lemon. They come from a flower and therefore contain seeds.

programme.title: Destination Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Okinawa
programme.desc: Genetic, biological, cultural and dietary factors combine to make the Japanese island of Okinawa a zone of extreme longevity. Why is it that cancer is virtually non-existent here? We'll see that the famous Japanese trio of "rice, fish and soy" is not the key to longevity, but a diet based on plants, lots of green leafy vegetables and endemic sweet potatoes. Self-restriction and strong social ties are other elements that our naturopathic chef and attending physician will discover on site, together with local inhabitants and scientists.

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized man's life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didn't manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. It's today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrel's price, we'll...

programme.desc: The joints are the first parts of the body to react badly to stress, therefore it is essential to relax and relieve them as often as possible. programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Senegal - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Nature’s Heroes: Senegal - Part 1
programme.desc: For this new episode, Yann Arthus-Bertrand travels through Senegal to encounter men and women who dedicate their lives to preserving the environment. One of the major ecological stakes of the country is fishing and the mangrove ecosystem which, like in some many other parts of the world, faces major threats. Yann Arthus-Bertrand presents the struggle of Haidar El Ali, chosen among one of the world’s most active ecologists. He creates protected marine areas and reforests the disappeared mangrove of his country. He’s managed to convince thousands of Senegalese to plant with him ten million mangrove trees.

programme.title: Spicy kitchen
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julie's Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Spicy kitchen
programme.desc: Today, Julie takes us on a tour of spices and aromatic plants. Spices are a call to travel, to faraway lands and to the unknown. In the kitchen, they bear witness to our relationship with others, reflecting our vision of the world. Julie's journey will introduce us to the famous black pepper, thanks to Erwann de Kerros, an insatiable pepper seeker. Aromatic plants will also be in the spotlight, as we pick them with Edouard Loubet in the Luberon...

programme.title: Escape

programme.title: Paddle Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Paddle Yoga
programme.desc: ValKahl tries out the addictive and zen yoga lesson on water on a paddleboard with YOGAqua, in Marina Del Rey. After learning to make some delightful and healthy wrap in restaurant KYE’S, she does sightseeing in Malibu Wine Hikes, the organic grapes garden behind Malibu’s famous beaches. Along the way, she can’t resist biting a mustard plant, feeding and ‘french kissing’ Stanley, the celebrity giraffe. She later harvests some fresh organic vegetables in Saddle Rock Garden!

programme.title: Chocolate Tan
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Chocolate Tan
programme.desc: Never thought yoga and chocolate could be a healthy combination? You were wrong! Since everything is organic in California, chocolate tanning is the best way to stay glamorous while taking care of your skin with natural and delicious products. After testing this chocolate tan, we'll be sweating it out at Tantris, the three-story yoga studio in the heart of Hollywood.

programme.title: Masashi Hirao
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Bonsai Bad Boy - Season 1 - Masashi Hirao
programme.desc: In 2003, Masashi Hirao became the last apprentice of Japan's great Bonsai master Saburo Kato. Before Saburo-san died he passed on to his apprentice a seemingly impossible mission: to prevent the 1000 year old art from dying-out in the face of a rapidly changing world and achieve his master’s vision of bringing peace to the world through bonsai. Masashi’s early efforts are dogged by many failures but combining his master’s guidance & modern instincts he sets out to travel the world and discover the way, drawing on innovative trends in contemporary art.

programme.title: Tough pregnancies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Family - Season 1 - Tough pregnancies
programme.desc: Clara and Gianni are worried, since a pregnancy with twins is always riskier. She’s due in two months, and has already undergone two medical interventions. Kim, nineteen, is fine physically, but she has to face her family’s criticism: she still lives at her parent’s, and the absence of the father-to-be worries them a great deal. Coralie would rather be safe than sorry, and meets with a prenatal consultant. Her nightmare: being turned down for an epidural procedure... Nathalie and Naoufel are looking at the bright side of life and are chilling on granddaddy’s boat, before letting themselves enjoy a family photo shoot.

programme.desc: Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

Then, we find ourselves in Las Vegas, on the verge of a shortage, and in Amman, Jordan, to discover the daily difficulties linked to the shortage and rationing of water. In Israel, the Dead Sea is disappearing. Due to intensive agriculture, the Jordan River and other rivers no longer supply it with enough water. In France, the Loire is for nature lovers, today a multitude of species have come to recolonise the river, including the famous wild salmon. programme.title: Journey To The West
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Bonsai Bad Boy - Season 1 - Journey To The West
programme.desc: Finding no way forward in Japan, Masashi looks to break through overseas. But although bonsai had spread widely in his master’s time, it seems doomed to wither if someone doesn’t do something to make the art form fun and relevant in a fast paced modern world. Finally on a trip to Italy, Masashi Hirao may have found a way to break the wall and build a bridge to new audiences. He determines to topple a 1000 years of tradition and turn the art of bonsai into a pop culture phenomenon, combining it with other art forms and focused on the process of creation as much as on the result.

programme.title: Last preps
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Family - Season 1 - Last preps
programme.desc: Clara and Gianni’s boys are born! But they came in a little bit early, and have been admitted in neonatal resuscitation... Coralie and Florent are still walking on clouds as they wait for their daughter, Lena. So are Nathalie and Naoufel, who arrange a tour of the future baby’s bedroom. Things are still tense between Kim and her parents. Her father blames here for having left school too early and the family makes no effort to hide their dislike of Pierre, the would-be father, who is still a no-show. They go as far as opposing Kim’s preferred choice for the future boy’s name, since it was his father that came up with the idea...

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Senegal - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Nature’s Heroes: Senegal - Part 2
programme.desc: For this new episode, Yann Arthus-Bertrand travels through Senegal to encounter men and women who dedicate their lives to preserving the environment. One of the major ecological stakes of the country is fishing and the mangrove ecosystem which, like in some many other parts of the world, faces major threats. Yann Arthus-Bertrand presents the struggle of Haidar El Ali, chosen among one of the world’s most active ecologists. He creates protected marine areas and reforests the disappeared mangrove of his country. He’s managed to convince thousands of Senegalese to plant with him ten million mangrove trees.
