programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: There are some exciting dishes on the menu today as the three chefs from the South West a region renowned for its seafood - tackle the fish course.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and Chef Chris Wheeler is out to show just how theatrical he can be, his ideas are surprising everyone in the kitchen. No one knows quite what to expect and the veteran chef is hoping it tastes as good as it looks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the dessert course and it is Josh Eggleton who has come up with the most ambitious dessert. He is creating his own self-serve ice cream made from vegetables, he is making everything from scratch.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The South West regions two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort and today they are joined by guest judge, journalist and restaurant critic, Grace Dent.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week two newcomers to the competition are challenging reigning North West champion Matt Worswick. Adam Reid is Head Chef for one of the UKs leading culinary talents Simon Rogan, heading up Simons The French restaurant at Manchesters Midland hotel.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and reigning NW champion Matt Worswick has reason to be confident. Last year his fish course was shortlisted for the banquet in the national finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course of the North West Regional heat and the scores mean this is a crucial round. Matt Worswick may be the reigning champion but he is not yet assured of a place cooking for the judges and he is feeling the strain.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the three North West competitors are getting highly creative producing some of the most original and stunning desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the two chefs are cooking for judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton. Its the dessert course that seals the fate of the chefs and the North West Champion is revealed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today three of the finest chefs from Wales are competing to be crowned champion. Two chefs are back for a second time: Phil Carmichael and Adam Bannister. Adam was crowed Welsh champion last year so this year Phil is back with something to prove.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the fish course and newcomer Andrew Birch is confident, he is passionate about seafood. Adam Bannister has created a modern take on the old boil in the bag fish dinners and Phil has chosen to revamp the classic prawn cocktail.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week three of finest chefs from Wales are competing to be crowned champion. Returning Chef, Phil Carmichael is serving up his version of an O.B.E, a refined take on onions, bacon and egg.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week in the Welsh heat newcomer Andrew Birch is challenging two returning chefs, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael. It is the dessert course and one chef will go home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Wales are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, blogger and food writer Rosie Birkett.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three newcomers are competing to become regional Central champion - Daniel Smith, Andrew Scott and Danny Gill. Danny Gill is a former head chef at Daniel Cliffords two star restaurant Midsummer House.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are using some of the UKs best seafood: lobster, salmon and Cornish crab. Daniel Smith may be classically trained but hes decided to take a risk adding a cheese custard to his lobster dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two chefs are cooking venison. Danny Gill is making a venison wellington, inspired by his Dad, a former RAF chef who has served up Wellington for royalty. While Andrew Scott has sourced his venison from the Queens Scottish estate, Balmoral.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week three chefs from the central region are fighting to be crowned champion. Today one competitor will go home, only the two highest scoring chefs will make it through to the judging chamber. And the chefs are pushing themselves.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The Central regions two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort, for the very first time.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: S11 : E26 London and South East Starter
programme.desc: Today three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: S11 : E27 London and South East Fish
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: S11 : E28 London and South East Main
programme.desc: Its the all important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Hes showcasing British Rose veal and celebrating the determination of British producers to bounce back from disaster.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: S11 : E29 London and South East Dessert
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South Easts most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: S11 : E30 London and South East Judging
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as Guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel is back for a second attempt at the North East Regional title but hes competing against two young newcomers Tommy Banks and Chris Archer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and two chefs from the North East, Tommy and Mini, have very similar ingredients - both are cooking mackerel.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the main course of the North East Region and overnight there has been a dramatic development. Its a tough and emotional day for the chefs.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is a highly emotional day for one of the chefs as he prepares a dish which is inspired by and a tribute to his own Great Briton, his late Grandfather.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the two chefs are cooking for the judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton. Joining them is guest judge is John Williams MBE, the executive Head Chef at The Ritz, the only hotel to hold a royal warrant for banqueting.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week three top chefs from Northern Ireland are competing for a place in the National Finals. There are some varied and exciting starters, as the chefs get creative. And theres real shock and emotion as the veteran chef delivers his scores.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more competitive as the three chefs from Northern Ireland dish cook their fish courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and returning Chef Chris McGowan is feeling confident but part of his dish involves making his own venison sausages to serve with a venison rack, and getting it all done in time is straining his emotions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for an historic score, he could beat his boss a veteran of GBM and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, restaurant critic and Editor-at-Large of the Independent, Amol Rajan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the National Finals of Great British Menu. The chefs will mark each course of the fellow chefs dishes; the average of their scores will be added to the judges scores. There are some shocks and surprises as the chefs opinions differ from the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is day two of Great British Menus National Finals. Today the eight champions will cook their fish courses. Two chefs have reason to be confident after scoring tens from every judge in the heats. Can they deliver a perfect dish second time round?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the National Finals of Great British Menu and main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. It is a nerve wracking day for three of the eight regional champions.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear sees if there is any truth in the old cliches - who are the better drivers, men or women? Can women park? Are men better at map reading? Which is the stronger sex on the race-track?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell tests he BMW M5, by driving from the UK to the famous Pau circuit in the South of France. Tom Ford tests the world's maddest car - the Ariel Atom.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell drives the Pagani Zonda, an astonishing Italian supercar that boasts a 7-litre, 550 horsepower engine and 200 mph plus performance.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell tests the new MGTF. He finds it a better road car than the old MGL but it's still not a track day car. Quentin Willson reveals some ways people try to get off their speeding tickets.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom drives the brand new Kia Soul - the most ambitious car from the Korean manufacturer to date. Vicki takes part in a trackday to demonstrate just how capable the BMW 330d is. Tiff brings us another stunning view of motorsport culture in Abu Dhabi.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear gets unprecedented access behind the scenes of the multi-million pound Renault Formula 1 team, and the unique competition they recently held to find an engineer of the future.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: In this special episode of the programme we reveal the winners of the Fifth Gear Awards 2006. There will be prizes for Best Small Car, Best Family Car, Best Fast Car and the overall Car of the Year.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell employs the help of two models to test the theory that the quicker you drive a convertible, the less your hair blows. He blasts the brand new Bentley Continental GTC up to 150mph.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason pits two almost identical Porsche Caymans. Jonny is enjoying some Spanish sun in the brand new Audi A5 cabriolet. Tim investigates the accuracy of the combined economy cycle. Jason helps Matthew Pinsent find his perfect car.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell and Vicki Butler-Henderson will be investigating what improvements mean in practice when they crash a brand new car head-on into a nine-year-old one.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell poses the question, "What's the best GT car you can buy for £90,000?" He tests the top contenders which both come from Stuttgart - the Mercedes SL55 AMG and the Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny and Vicki review two mighty 4x4's in one of the shows muddiest Dog Fights. Elsewhere, the team hit the road in the all-new Alpine A110 to find out what's changed since the first incarnation hit our streets back in 1961.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The guys test drive Mazda's latest hatchback as Vicki unveils the long-awaited new Tesla Model 3 electric car; finding out if the Porsche Cayman still is the king of the £50,000 sports cars.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell tests the two hottest hatches of the year with British rally legend Mark Higgins, the team test a brand new Mercedes convertible, Vicki Butler-Henderson races a brand new Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The guys hit the track to test out the new Volvo XC40. And, Jimmy De Ville goes back to the '80s to find out how Audi devised the revolutionary four-wheel drive system.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: For the first time, Tiff Needell (Fifth Gear founder, ex-Top Gear presenter and racing driver) has brought together his 10 favourite Supercar road tests from the programme in one high octane compilation.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason is joined by ex-Ferrari F1 driver Mika Salon to pit the brand new £100,000 Mercedes C63 AMG Black Series against its key rival from BMW. Tiff celebrates the iconic Ferrari F40's 25th birthday with a track drive of one of the best in the world.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato and Tiff Needell host a battle of the best cheap hot hatches on sale. The Ford Fiesta ST, RenaultSport Clio and Peugeot 208 GTI are all thrashed to the limit before Tiff and Jason reveal the champion.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff races the Peugeot RCZ Coupe against its Volkswagen Scirocco rival, Jonny heads to Germany to find out if the new Nissan Juke crossover is as bonkers as it looks, Vicki tests the Honda CR-Z which claims to be the world's first sporty hybrid.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson enters the brutal world of professional truck racing. She drives a 1100bhp truck herself, before heading to the Nurburgring where she joins the pit crew of former champion, German Jochen Hahn.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: A Land Rover Defender 90 versus a Suzuki Jimny, and in the shoot-out: Volkswagen Up GTI versus a Suzuki Swift Sport.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason pits two almost identical Porsche Caymans. Jonny is enjoying some Spanish sun in the brand new Audi A5 cabriolet. Tim investigates the accuracy of the combined economy cycle. Jason helps Matthew Pinsent find his perfect car.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Iwan accepts a stunt challenge from world famous precision driver Russ Swift; we observe supercars trying to beat the 0-62 world record; Jonny secretly repairs the potholes that local councils refuse to.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson and Tiff Needell look at the car accident that's ten times as likely to cause you an injury as any other; a rear impact.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson was the only British journalist invited to test drive Ferrari's new race car, the F430 Challenge. Tom Ford takes an exclusive one-off look into the secret world of the Maybach.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell test drives the new Aston Martin V8 Vantage, billed as the most desirable sportscar in the world. Jon Bentley reveals definitively whether expensive petrol is worth the extra cash.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson finds out if the new Fiat Panda 100HP is as quick as a Ferrari round a track, Jason Plato tries to crack 200mph on the public road in the £230,000 Brabus Rocket.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: We pit the Ford Sierra Cosworth and the Mercedes 190E Cosworth against each other. Tim in London investigates the new craze of car share clubs. Tiff drives the brand new Nissan 370Z around what used to be one of the fastest race circuits in Europe.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki tests two cars that are low, light and very fast - Lotus Exige S v Caterham CSR. Tom visits Spain to drive the Toyota Landcruiser. Jason Plato drives the Mercedes CLK63 Black. Tiff teaches Heston Blumenthal the art of powersliding.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki finds out which is quickest - an old Vauxhall against a new one. Jonny Smith and Tom Ford contest one of motor sport's oldest and most gruelling events, the Exeter Trial. Tiff Needell goes to France to drive the new Audi A3 Cabriolet.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford puts the Bentley Continental Flying Spur to the test. We take the fastest four door saloon in the world on a tour of Britain and see just how many swanky events Tom can visit in 24 hours?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato gets a world's first test drive in the £380,000 Pagani Zonda F. Vicki Butler-Henderson heads to our Anglesey test track to race a Porsche 911 against the latest Lotus Exige.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear guest presenter and Touring Car champion Jason Plato tests Chrysler's new 300C. Is this would-be competitor for the likes of the Mercedes E-class really a car to be taken seriously?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason & Tiff battle against each other in the purest form of motor-sport: karting. Dirk Benedict joins Jonny Smith in a luxury road test. Tom Ford tests the Renault Laguna - it's rear wheels steer like magic but is it as good as the Mondeo?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki takes two Audi TTs to the track for a shoot-out - one has a manual gearbox, the other a semi-automatic - to see which is faster; Jason drives the Bowler Nemesis, a 500 bhp extreme off-roader designed to tackle the world's toughest rallies.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Quentin Willson, Tiff Needell, Vicki Butler-Henderson and Adrian Simpson visit the British International Motorshow. They look at some of the cars they didn't see at the recent Paris show.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear decides on its favourite sportscar. Which open-topped two seater offers the most fun - will it be a TVR, Lotus, or Porsche?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson tries to crack 150mph as she makes an attempt on the Blindfolded Land Speed World Record. Can Vicki hold her nerve and set a new record for driving in a straight line?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford drives Volvo's stylish new coupe, the C30; and Tiff Needell tests whether a green supercar really can be fun in Lotus' bio-fuel powered Exige 265E.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson finds out which is the fastest - the Renault Twingo GT or the Fiat Panda 100HP. Tiff Needell and Jason Plato go head to head. This time it's small coupes as the Porsche Cayman comes up against the new BMW 135i Coupe.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson is taught how to drive a car on two wheels; Jonny Smith gets to be a real live human crash test dummy when he visits Germany for some extreme airbag testing.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason and Tiff take on a dogfight with a difference - racing buses! Jonny invents three practical tests for the new Mercedes E-Class. Tim investigates the Government's new scrappage system. Tom is on a mission in the stunning new Aston Martin.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki finds out which is quickest, the VW Golf GTi or Subaru Impreza WRX. Jonny proves there are still some amazing cars that you can buy for under £1500. Jason tests the Lotus Elise to find out if this is the finest car Lotus has ever produced.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson and Tiff Needell drive some of the best cars made in Britain today. They also celebrate Britain's amazingly diverse and fertile sports car industry.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson test drives Volvo's new off-roader. He concludes because of their attention to safety, the environment and the family-size accommodation Volvo have created a different kind of 4x4.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford tests the brand new Ford Fiesta. Vicki Butler-Henderson and Tiff Needell challenge each other on two wheels. Jonny shows us three great, affordable cars. Jason Plato takes the Porsche 911 GT2 out on the track.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato teaches Girls Aloud how to become racing drivers. Tiff Needell drives the new Maserati Quattroporte, and Tom Ford tries to break the world record for doing "donuts" in a car.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff races the top of the range £60,000 supercharged Sport cross country against...a horse. Vicki Butler-Henderson finds out exactly how easy it is to control the £160,000 Lamborghini Murcielago.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: In this edition of we're literally taking Fifth Gear to new heights and celebrating the most spectacular challenge petrol-heads have ever invented.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jon Bentley investigates how hitting a motorway crash barrier can make your car fly through the air. Jason Plato gives cricketer Kevin Petersen the chance to drive the Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear will be testing three of the most economical cars on the market. There's the petrol-powered Daihatsu Charade and the diesel-powered Citroen C2 and the "hybrid" Toyota Prius.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear presents some of the best Hot Hatches - those clever cars that neatly combine practicality, performance and affordability - that have featured on the show over the last twenty years.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason and Karun discover the new version of the legendary Porsche 911, the Carrera 4S. Jonny checks the future of autonomous cars in South Korea.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell blasts through France's champagne region in Aston Martin's latest convertible, Vicki Butler-Henderson acts as umpire in a race between two England cricket stars.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki gives us behind the scenes access as she judges the Best Supercar award at the Salon Prive. Tiff and Jason race head-to-head in the Mitsubishi Evo FQ400 and the Nissan GT-R to find the best Japanese super saloon.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear presenter Jonny Smith is granted access-all-areas to Kia's top secret test facility in the Californian desert where he investigates the lengths manufacturers go to in the quest for ever greater reliability.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny enters the world of professional drifting as competes in the famous Gatebil show in Norway, driving a specially modified BMW M5. To give himself a fighting chance, he first arranges some tuition from the 2011 British Drift Champion Matt Carter.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith goes behind the scenes at the gruelling Isle of Man TT motorbike race, and spends the day with TT hero and 19 times winner John McGuinness. Tiff Needell races around the infamous TT circuit in the brand new Subaru BRZ sports car.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell and motoring journalist Chris Harris put two track focused supercars through their paces - the Ferrari 458 Speciale and the Porsche 911 GT3. Tests involving agility, road manners and head to head racing will decide which is best.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell and Formula E driver Karun Chandhok race two supercar GTs worth over £400,000 between them, the Ferrari F12 and Aston Martin Vanquish. Jonny Smith looks at the ultimate British getaway car of the 1960's, the Mk2 Jaguar.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: In this episode of Fifth Gear Tiff Needell and Vicki Butler-Henderson take part in a unique car v plane challenge. Nigel Lamb is the current Red Bull Air Race champion, which makes him the airborne equivalent of Lewis Hamilton.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford's been testing the Mazda's new MX5 Roadster Coupe; and Vicki Butler-Henderson has been thrashing Porsche's 911 GT3.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The pestilential nuisance of cowboy clamping is now more common than ever. There are no rules or regulations governing the renegade companies that organise these rackets.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason takes two sporty convertibles - the Mini Cooper Cabriolet and Mazda MX-5 onto the track for a hair-do busting shootout. Tim Shaw heads to a garage...with no mechanics! Tiff spends some quality time in the brand new Aston Martin V12 Vantage.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell tests the latest car to join the elite ranks of road cars capable of over 200mph includes such mouthwatering prospects as the Enzo Ferrari, the Pagani Zonda, and the Porsche Carerra GT .

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson road tests the Renault VelSatis. Renault's attempt to tackle the executive car sector dominated by Mercedes, Audi and BMW has unusual styling but he likes it.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff heads to Anglesey to see what's quickest; a Smart Brabus or Mini Cooper S when they get pitched head to head in the Fifth Gear shoot out.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson tries to crack 150mph as she makes an attempt on the Blindfolded Land Speed World Record. Can Vicki hold her nerve and set a new record for driving in a straight line?

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford tests the latest version of the car that is perennially voted one of Britain's favourite cars - the Land Rover Defender. Jonny Smith celebrates Ferrari's 60th Birthday.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford flies out on Alan Sugar's private jet to test the brand new Audi TT, Vicki Butler-Henderson attempts a new land speed record, and Tiff Needell enters the inaugural D1GB drifting competition.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: In a superb world first, Tiff Needell gets to drive a Williams Formula 1 Grand Prix car. With exclusive access to the team we're allowed to follow Tiff every step of the way.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato gets a world's first test drive in the £380,000 Pagani Zonda F. Vicki Butler-Henderson heads to our Anglesey test track to race a Porsche 911 against the latest Lotus Exige.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford tests Nissan's new Micra. He finds it well-made and easy-to-drive. Adrian Simpson goes in search haunted cars. He starts by being very sceptical that haunted cars can exist at all.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell tests he BMW M5, by driving from the UK to the famous Pau circuit in the South of France. Tom Ford tests the world's maddest car - the Ariel Atom.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Quentin Willson enlists the help of a car psychologist to cure one sufferer who finds it impossible to drive without swearing profusely at other drivers.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki is the first journalist in the world to drive the astonishing £150,000 Gibbs Aquada, an amphibious car that breaks the mould. Vicki tests it out on the open road and the ocean wave.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki takes two Audi TTs to the track for a shoot-out - one has a manual gearbox, the other a semi-automatic - to see which is faster; Jason drives the Bowler Nemesis, a 500 bhp extreme off-roader designed to tackle the world's toughest rallies.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: What do you think is more dangerous - driving whilst being drunk, or driving whilst being tired? Tiff Needell spends a day in the pub and Quentin Willson deprives himself of sleep for 2 days.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff and Jason head to the track in the new BMW Z4 and Porsche Boxster. Jonny gets behind the wheel of what could be the most perfect car in the world - the brand new Golf GTi. Tiff Needell is in the first all-new Lotus for 13 years - the Evora.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff pits Renault's latest hot hatch the stripped out and hardcore Megane R26.R, against a Caterham CDX. Jonny brings us his verdict on the brand new Ford Ka. Tim delves into the world of car crime, to make us more aware of what criminals look for.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell drives Suzuki's hot hatch, the Swift Sport; Tom Ford drives the awesome Aussie supercar, the Vauxhall Monaro; Vicki Butler-Henderson fulfils a lifetime ambition and drives a racing truck.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Fifth Gear Vicki Butler-Henderson drives the one-off supercharged Nissan Murano GTC; Jonny Smith challenges the world's biggest lawnmower to a head to head in a grass cutting contest.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato helps a lottery winner choose a new supercar, Tiff Needell road tests the new Jaguar XK on the best road in the world, and Tom Ford meets Jenson Button at the Geneva Motorshow.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff and Jason pit the Volkswagen Scirocco and Mini Cooper S against each other. Green driving is the subject of Jonny's attention as he gets behind the wheel of Honda's Insight hybrid. Tom drives the world's smallest four seater - the Toyota iQ.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff races the top of the range £60,000 supercharged Sport cross country against...a horse. Vicki Butler-Henderson finds out exactly how easy it is to control the £160,000 Lamborghini Murcielago.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell and Vicki Butler-Henderson will be investigating what improvements mean in practice when they crash a brand new car head-on into a nine-year-old one.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tom Ford and Jonny Smith enter a demolition derby in two unlikely vehicles, Reliant Robins. Tiff Needell tests the latest Porsche 911, the GT3RS. Vicki Butler-Henderson drives the new Vauxhall VXR8.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tim Shaw is the latest car nut to join the team, and he's been specially tasked with standing up for the beleaguered motorist. Jason Plato and Tiff Needell go head to head on the track to find out which car is fastest.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Tiff Needell and Jason Plato race two V8 mega-saloons. Tom Ford has the only television test of the charismatic Dodge Challenger. Vicki Butler-Henderson finds out which car is quickest between the Vauxhall Astra Nurburgring and Ford Focus ST.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Chris Vermeulen one of the hottest young racers of the moment challenges Vicki to a drag race, and Tiff's shoot out is between the Ford Fiesta ST 150 and the Mitsubishi Colt CZT.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki and Jason take a day trip to France in the Ferrari 812 Superfast and Aston Martin DBS Superleggera. And, Jonny is at the Frankfurt Motor Show.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny and Jimmy head to S. Korea to discover how they made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason hits the track in an Alpine A110.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: In this episode of Fifth Gear Tiff Needell and Vicki Butler-Henderson take part in a unique car v plane challenge. Nigel Lamb is the current Red Bull Air Race champion, which makes him the airborne equivalent of Lewis Hamilton.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki gives us behind the scenes access as she judges the Best Supercar award at the Salon Prive. Tiff and Jason race head-to-head in the Mitsubishi Evo FQ400 and the Nissan GT-R to find the best Japanese super saloon.

programme.title: A Little Faith
programme.desc: On an undercover training exercise Traci and Andy stumble upon a woman who is about to die of an overdose.

programme.title: On the Double
programme.desc: When Gail Peck’s uniform is stolen, the rookies go after a vigilante who is impersonating a police officer.

programme.title: God's Good Grace
programme.desc: While Swarek is brutally interrogated, the rookies help Andy solve a mystery that may reveal Swarek’s location

programme.title: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
programme.desc: When a girl vanishes from the scene of a multi-car accident, Andy connects the girl to a 7-year-old cold case.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: As high schools wind to a close for summer, dangerous pranks abound – including the theft of a police car.

programme.title: A Good Shoot
programme.desc: Dov Epstein happens upon a convenience store robbery-in-progress that results in him shooting a black teenager

programme.title: Girls' Night Out
programme.desc: Hell breaks loose when a carload of girls from a bachelorette party hits another vehicle, killing the driver.

programme.title: Messy Houses
programme.desc: When Andy answers a domestic disturbance call, the social worker turns out to be her estranged mother.

programme.title: Coming Home
programme.desc: A noise complaint leads Andy and Swarek to an illegal warehouse party, and to an injured John Doe.

programme.title: Leap of Faith
programme.desc: A gifted psychic (or a gifted conman) helps find the missing witness in an organized-crime case.

programme.title: The Girlfriend Experience
programme.desc: While investigating the disappearance of an escort, the officers discover a pattern of missing women.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: The officers of 15 Division are forced to release a suspected predator for lack of evidence.

programme.title: Cold Comforts
programme.desc: The officers of 15 Division are reeling in the aftermath of the unexpected death of one of their colleagues.

programme.title: The Rules
programme.desc: Staff Sergeant Frank Best decides it_s time for his officers to get back on track.

programme.title: Every Man
programme.desc: Andy and Nick investigate a torched van. It belongs a street priest who's been receiving death threats.

programme.title: I Never
programme.desc: When a child abductor escapes from an emergency hospital visit, 15 Division goes on the hunt for the criminal.

programme.title: Surprises
programme.desc: After months working undercover, Andy and Nick’s operation goes sideways when Nick - then Andy - go missing.

programme.title: Homecoming
programme.desc: On her first day back at 15 Division, Andy must work with Swarek to track down an ex-convict.

programme.title: Different, Not Better
programme.desc: Andy is partnered with Swarek’s new girlfriend, Officer Marlo Cruz.

programme.title: The Kids Are Not Alright
programme.desc: A routine highway check leads to the discovery of a teenage boy in the trunk of a car.

programme.title: Poison Pill
programme.desc: After a messy drug arrest, Andy and Marlo are quarantined together.

programme.title: Skeletons
programme.desc: There's a possible connection between a missing woman and one of the division’s most distressing cases.

programme.title: Friday the 13th
programme.desc: When human bones found in a ravine open up a 15-year-old case, Swarek reunites with his old training officer.

programme.title: For Better, for Worse
programme.desc: Things get complicated when the team gets called to a hijacked casino bus full of senior citizens.

programme.title: What I Lost
programme.desc: When Chris returns for a visit, his reunion takes a shocking turn when his son, Christian, is abducted.

programme.title: You Are Here
programme.desc: Near the end of a shift, 15 Division busts a marijuana grow-op.

programme.title: Deception
programme.desc: When a pedophile is found beaten, Andy discovers Marlo has been conducting an off-hours “investigation."

programme.title: Under Fire
programme.desc: Someone with a grudge against 15 Division opens fire on Andy and Chloe.

programme.title: You Can See the Stars
programme.desc: The officers have to piece together the truth about a past crime in order to find Oliver Shaw.

programme.title: Blink
programme.desc: Andy and Dov pull themselves together at an all-night diner, but are caught off-guard in a diner hold-up.

programme.title: All By Her Selfie
programme.desc: Oliver gets promoted to Acting Staff Sergeant, and Andy is tasked with training 15 Division’s newest rookie.

programme.title: Heart Breakers, Money Makers
programme.desc: Inspector Jarvis sends the officers to seize all “proceeds of crime” – anything purchased with illegal money.

programme.title: Wanting
programme.desc: After the discovery of an executed gang leader, 15 Division must find the killer before a gang war breaks out.

programme.title: Going Under
programme.desc: When 15 Division goes undercover at a club-land bar, Chris’s erratic behavior make Dov suspicious.

programme.title: Two Truths and a Lie
programme.desc: As the officers try to hunt down the killer of Brian Gowdy – Andy and Sam go on the road for interviews.

programme.title: Deal with the Devil
programme.desc: Oliver prepares Andy to defend herself at Duncan’s dismissal hearing, now happening two hours from now.

programme.title: Exit Strategy
programme.desc: An innocuous call to a middle-class home puts Dov and Chris in the middle of a home invasion investigation.

programme.title: Moving Day
programme.desc: 15 Division works on a program to help tenants move out of a subsidized-housing complex that’s being torn down

programme.title: Fragments
programme.desc: Andy’s former rookie, Duncan, is back on duty and looking to reconcile – something she’s not ready for yet.

programme.title: Everlasting
programme.desc: The officers work to find a bomber. But after catching him, they realize he has more targets set to explode.

programme.title: Open Windows
programme.desc: Andy is attacked by an intruder at Traci’s place and the Sex Crimes Unit steps in to take over the case.

programme.title: Perfect Family
programme.desc: Andy debates her future with Sam after learning the heart-breaking news that Marlo is pregnant with his baby.

programme.title: Uprising
programme.desc: A riot breaks out at a women’s prison while Andy, Juliet, Nick, and Gail are there to transfer prisoners.

programme.title: Letting Go
programme.desc: Nick’s estranged older brother emerges with new information on someone from their tragic past.

programme.title: A Real Gentleman
programme.desc: When Traci is a no-show for her first raid, 15 Division fears the gun dealer they’re after has kidnapped her.

programme.title: Home Run
programme.desc: After a baseball game erupts in a drive-by shooting, Gail and her brother search for the shooter.

programme.title: Best Man
programme.desc: Andy and Sam are shocked to learn that Oliver is the prime suspect in IA’s corruption investigation.

programme.title: Integrity Test
programme.desc: Andy, Dov, Gail, and Nick undertake a risky plan to prove that Commissioner Alonso Santana is corrupt.

programme.title: Ninety Degrees
programme.desc: A heat wave hits and Jarvis opens the division to the public as a cooling station.

programme.title: Breaking Up the Band
programme.desc: Now that Sam and Marlo’s baby girl has arrived, it’s clear nothing could have prepared Andy for this moment.

programme.title: 74 Epiphanies
programme.desc: With the 15 Division restructure looming, Andy and Sam’s wedding lets the gang celebrate one last hurrah.

programme.title: Fresh Paint
programme.desc: A high-stakes takedown goes awry upon the revelation that rookie cop Andy McNally has busted one of her own.

programme.title: Mercury Retrograde
programme.desc: As the other rookies hunt for an escaped convict, Swarek lets Andy in on his past undercover exploits.

programme.title: Fite Nite
programme.desc: The rookie cops duke it out for a cause at “Fite Nite.”

programme.title: Signals Crossed
programme.desc: Andy trades in her uniform for something more risqué when she goes undercover as a prostitute.

programme.title: Broad Daylight
programme.desc: During a home invasion, Andy is left alone and confronted with a hiding thief who is armed and very volatile.

programme.title: Bullet Proof
programme.desc: A fatal traffic collision reveals a shocking truth, and Andy’s romance with Det. Callaghan gets complicated.

programme.title: Hot & Bothered
programme.desc: A heat wave has wreaked havoc on the city, multiplied by growing fears of a serial rapist on the loose.

programme.title: Honour Roll
programme.desc: Andy and Chris investigate a nightclub beating, but all clues point to a cop.

programme.title: Girlfriend of the Year
programme.desc: At a highway accident, Chris and Gail stumble upon a car that has a license plate matched to an Amber Alert.

programme.title: Big Nickel
programme.desc: A botched prisoner transport has Andy and Swarek in a cat-and-mouse game to catch the fugitive.

programme.title: To Serve or Protect
programme.desc: Andy’s ex-cop father has confessed that he may have committed a crime during an alcohol-induced blackout.

programme.title: Judgment Day
programme.desc: It’s time for performance assessments for the rookies as they find out the fate of their careers.

programme.title: Takedown
programme.desc: When an arrest compromises a drug bust, Andy steps up to salvage the bust by going undercover with Swarek.

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Andy's world explodes when a student is killed in a shooting, and a bullet hits Andy, lodging in her vest.

programme.title: Might Have Been
programme.desc: Andy and Gail go undercover as cocktail waitresses to clean up a drug-infested club.

programme.title: Bad Moon Rising
programme.desc: As a full moon hangs over the city, the rookies are unnerved by a series of strange occurrences.

programme.title: A Round of Golf
programme.desc: Mr. Bean fancies a game of golf.

programme.title: Cash Machine
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants to buy a cupcake, but his wallet is empty, so he has to visit a cash dispenser.

programme.title: Litterbugs
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town.

programme.title: Halloween
programme.desc: On Halloween night, Mr. Bean prepares to give the children some tricks and treats they won't forget.

programme.title: Bean Phone
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants a smartphone but does not have enough money to buy one.

programme.title: Restaurant
programme.desc: Mr Bean makes a meal out of his Birthday celebration.

programme.title: The Lift
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes on a lift to the top floor of a toy shop, but Teddy gets stuck in the doors and jams the lift.

programme.title: Ball Pool
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants to play inside the local play area, but he is not allowed to enter.

programme.title: Mobile Home
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind.

programme.title: All You Can Eat
programme.desc: Irma is coming for dinner, but Mr. Bean has forgotten about it and so doesn't have anything to cook.

programme.title: Superhero Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes a superhero in an attempt to stop a cunning thief.

programme.title: Special Delivery
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair.

programme.title: Wrestle Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is trying to read a book but he is disturbed by the noise of Mrs. Wicket and her friend.

programme.title: Art Thief
programme.desc: Mr Bean tries his hand as an international art sleuth.

programme.title: Bean Bug
programme.desc: Scrapper gives Bean fleas, and Bean is forced to call in the pest control person.

programme.title: Treasure!
programme.desc: A puzzling puzzle has Mr Bean truly puzzled.

programme.title: Magpie
programme.desc: Mr Bean gets in a complete flap when he befriends a feathered thief.

programme.title: The Cruise
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime.

programme.title: Muscle Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean needs to impress Irma, who is infatuated with the hunky deliveryman.

programme.title: The Sofa
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds himself with more than a spring in his step.

programme.title: Roadworks
programme.desc: Mr Bean is driven to distraction by diabolical decibels.

programme.title: Homeless
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs to let a room but no one will let him.

programme.title: Spring Clean
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds that cleanliness can be a filthy business.

programme.title: For Sale
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is persuaded by a jaunty estate agent to put her house up for sale.

programme.title: Car Trouble
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes to the air after being taken for a ride.

programme.title: The Mole
programme.desc: Mr Bean loses control of a pest and makes a mountain out of a molehill.

programme.title: Hopping Mad!
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds that tons of toads weigh loads and loads.

programme.title: Bean Shopping
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is locked in a department store overnight having the time of his life.

programme.title: Hotel Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has some unexpected guests who think he runs a hotel!

programme.title: Super-Trolley
programme.desc: Mr Bean builds a supermarket super trolley.

programme.title: Birthday Party
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is feeling down when everyone forgot his birthday.

programme.title: Artful Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean gets a real bug for painting. Then several bugs… and flies and slugs and mice.

programme.title: Hot Date
programme.desc: Romance is in the air and Bean's girlfriend is determined to have a piece of it.

programme.title: Bean At The Museum
programme.desc: Mr. Bean thinks he’s just dug up a valuable coin in the back-garden.

programme.title: A Royal Makeover
programme.desc: Mr Bean redecorates his room, making it fit for a Queen.

programme.title: Keyboard Capers
programme.desc: Determined to play the piano, Mr Bean finds a tune in his heart and sausages for fingers.

programme.title: Charity Bean
programme.desc: Bean is both cajoled by Irma and spurred by his own jealousy of the fund-raising super-star Declan.

programme.title: Spa Day
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean drives her and Miss Wince to their booked spa retreat.

programme.title: Missing Teddy
programme.desc: Bean discovers that, in the world of organised crime, a teddy isn’t always a teddy. Sometimes it’s a rabbit.

programme.title: Toothache
programme.desc: Mr Bean bites off more than he can chew when he attempts DIY dentistry.

programme.title: Valentine's Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean tries to be romantic, but his idea of what that means is different to Irma's.

programme.title: Fish Sitting
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has to look after Mrs. Wicket's goldfish.

programme.title: Dinner For Two
programme.desc: When invited to dinner by Mr Bean, it’s probably best to take your own sandwiches.

programme.title: Gadget Kid
programme.desc: High-tech wizardry and low-tech cunning get Mr Bean out of a jam.

programme.title: Ice Cream
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants an ice cream cone from the ice cream van.

programme.title: Stick It
programme.desc: Bean discovers Mrs. Wicket’s nephew and Bruiser Jnr swopping football stickers.

programme.title: A Grand Invitation
programme.desc: Mr Bean is all at sea with the landed gentry.

programme.title: Super Sky
programme.desc: Fascinated by the super spy show, Mr. Bean decides to become a super spy himself. When he becomes suspicious of the Bruisers planning something, he starts to follow them. Later, he notices that the Bruisers are putting an old lady into a van.

programme.title: Coffee Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is out shopping when it starts to rain.

programme.title: Rare Bird
programme.desc: Mr. Bean loves bird spotting and is desperate to tick off the last elusive bird in his book.

programme.title: Camping
programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers the great outdoors is not always so great.

programme.title: Camping
programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers the great outdoors is not always so great.

programme.title: Cat-Sitting
programme.desc: Mr Bean is forced to look after his worst enemy.

programme.title: Bean Hypnotised
programme.desc: Mr. Bean attends a hypnotism show where he unwittingly volunteers to be hypnotized.

programme.title: Dead Cat
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to replace his landlady’s cat after an unfortunate ‘accident’.

programme.title: Back To School
programme.desc: When there's no milk for his tea and for Teddy, Mr. Bean goes to buy some.

programme.title: Coconut Shy
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has to buy a cup for Teddy, but he has no money.

programme.title: Birthday Bear
programme.desc: Mr Bean forgets his teddy’s Birthday - then gives him a treat to remember.

programme.title: Jurassic Bean
programme.desc: While Mr. Bean is taking photos of wildlife, he sees big footprints belonging to a dinosaur.

programme.title: A Dog's Life
programme.desc: Mr Bean dog-sits for Irma and while in the park comes across a professional dog-walker.

programme.title: Rat Trap
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has to deal with an unwanted house guest but the stubborn rat refuses to leave.

programme.title: A New Friend
programme.desc: A small bird wants to befriend Mr. Bean, but its squawking sound annoys Mrs. Wicket.

programme.title: Dig This
programme.desc: It is a nice sunny day and Mr. Bean and Mrs. Wicket are relaxing in the garden.

programme.title: Taxi Bean
programme.desc: When one of the toy cars of his racing track set becomes broken, Mr. Bean decides to buy a new one.

programme.title: Scout Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes a Scoutmaster for the day.

programme.title: Jumping Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants to learn skateboarding but hurts himself on his first try.

programme.title: Young Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes a trip down Memory Lane.

programme.title: Car Wash
programme.desc: After a stubborn bird deliberately defecates his Mini, Mr. Bean washes it.

programme.title: Viral Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants to read his book but gets interrupted by too much noise.

programme.title: Cat Chaos
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes annoyingly inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing.

programme.title: The Photograph
programme.desc: The airport personnel refuses to let Mr. Bean take a flight due to his passport having no photo.

programme.title: Running On Empty
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol.

programme.desc: Reunited at last, Yugi and his friends rejoice.

programme.desc: Grandpa translates an ancient stone tablet which directs the gang to locate the “Fortress of Fear.”

programme.desc: It’s on to level three as Yugi and his friends are transported to a lava-covered wasteland.

programme.desc: Although the gang has passed the five sacred trials, the most dangerous test is yet to come.

programme.desc: Yugi’s friends are unconscious, leaving him to defeat Alexander the Great on his own!

programme.desc: Luna, Torunka, and Regulus confront Zeman the Ape King, the Duel Monster spirit who has taken the Ancient Fairy Dragon captive. Meanwhile, in the human world, Devack manages to Summon "Zeman the Ape King" in his Duel against Leo.

programme.title: Mark of the Monkey, Part 4
programme.desc: After defeating Zeman the Ape King and saving Ancient Fairy Dragon, Luna arrives in the human world just in time to help her brother Leo win his Duel against Devack, who has just Summoned "Earthbound Immortal Cusillu".

programme.title: A Whale of a Ride, Part 1
programme.desc: With Devack defeated, Roman Goodwin turns Greiger into a Dark Signer. Crow, who survived the black fog, challenges Greiger to a Duel to avenge the children who disappeared in the fog.

programme.title: A Whale of a Ride, Part 2
programme.desc: Crow and Greiger continue their Duel while Yusei tries to stop it. During the Duel, Crow remembers his childhood in which he learned the importance of strategy and friendship.

programme.title: A Whale of a Ride, Part 3
programme.desc: Greiger manages to Summon "Earthbound Immortal Chacu Challhua" in his Duel against Crow, but the latter has more tricks up his sleeve.

programme.title: A Score To Settle, Part 1
programme.desc: Yusei and Kalin meet up again and prepare for their rematch. During their Duel, more details of their past as members of The Enforcers are revealed and how their group disbanded.

programme.title: A Score To Settle, Part 2
programme.desc: Yusei and Kalin continue their Duel and Kalin hopes to win against his former friend with "Earthbound Immortal Ccapac Apu". Despite this, Yusei is determined to save his friend. The powers of the Crimson Dragon enable him to call forth a new monster, "Majestic Star Dragon".

programme.title: Destiny´s Will, Part 1
programme.desc: Yusei confronts Roman at the original Ener-D Reactor and Duels him. During the Duel, Roman reveals another secret in which neither Yusei, nor his friends expected to hear.

programme.title: Destiny´s Will, Part 2
programme.desc: Roman reveals to Yusei, Trudge, Leo and Luna that he was the fifth Signer, which shocks everyone, as well as how the former fifth Signer corrupted himself and became a Dark Signer.

programme.title: Shadows of Doubt, Part 1
programme.desc: Jack finds Carly at the Hummingbird Tower. However, Jack hesitates to attack her and Carly uses a special card on Jack to make him see of what the future might be if he loses the Duel.

programme.title: Shadows of Doubt, Part 2
programme.desc: The Duel between Jack and Carly continues. When Carly seems to regain her senses, the spirit of the "Earthbound Immortal" takes control of her so that the Duel can continue. Now, Jack's only hope lies in the power of the Crimson Dragon.

programme.title: Truth and Consequences, Part 1
programme.desc: Akiza confronts Misty at the Lizard Tower. Meanwhile, Sayer, who survived the destruction of his Arcadia Movement Headquarters, uses his psychic powers to control Akiza so he can use her to defeat Misty.

programme.desc: The fearless bandit king Bakura has invaded the Pharaoh’s palace to take down the keepers of the seven Millennium Items single-handedly!

programme.title: The Intruder, Part 2
programme.desc: Even with the potent power of Obelisk the Tormentor, the Pharaoh couldn’t prevent the bandit Bakura from escaping!

programme.title: Makings of a Magician
programme.desc: Mahad vows to stop the bandit king Bakura’s sneak attacks once and for all, but he may have made a promise he can’t keep!

programme.title: Birth of the Blue-Eyes
programme.desc: Mahad, the first of the Pharaoh’s guardians, has fallen!

programme.title: Village of Lost Souls
programme.desc: The origins of the Millennium Items are revealed! Who forged these powerful artifacts, and why were they created?

programme.title: A Reversal of Fortune
programme.desc: The Pharaoh calls forth the mighty Egyptian God Slifer the Sky Dragon to fight the bandit Bakura’s Diabound.

programme.title: In Search of a King
programme.desc: The bandit Bakura has stolen the Millennium Puzzle and sent the Pharaoh plummeting into the abyss.

programme.title: Village of Vengeance, Part 1
programme.desc: Yugi and the Pharaoh are reunited, but the Pharaoh is powerless without the Millennium Puzzle!

programme.title: Village of Vengeance, Part 2
programme.desc: It’s the showdown in the sands between the bandit Bakura and his ever-growing Diabound versus the Pharaoh.

programme.title: Village of Vengeance, Part 3
programme.desc: With the help of his father’s spirit, the Pharaoh and his guardians defeated Bakura’s Diabound and stopped Zorc from resurrecting... or did they?

programme.title: Village of Vengeance, Part 4
programme.desc: The secret is out! The Pharaoh’s journey was more than a trip to the past – it’s the greatest Shadow Game ever created!

programme.title: Village of Vengeance, Part 5
programme.desc: Zorc’s incredible shadow energies have resurrected the bandit Bakura and his Diabound!

programme.title: Name of the Game
programme.desc: Karim is the next to fall under the bandit Bakura’s assault, and the ravaging robber won’t stop until he conquers the rest!

programme.title: The Dark One Cometh, Part 1
programme.desc: After a nearly eternal slumber, the all-powerful Zorc has resurrected, plunging the world into darkness!

programme.title: The Dark One Cometh, Part 2
programme.desc: The Pharaoh and his guardians are down to their last line of defense as Shada falls victim to Zorc!

programme.title: The Dark One Cometh, Part 3
programme.desc: Even Exodia the Forbidden One was unable to defeat Zorc!

programme.title: The Dark One Cometh, Part 4
programme.desc: The three Egyptian Gods have been defeated!

programme.title: In the Name of the Pharaoh
programme.desc: The Pharaoh and Kaiba’s combined strength couldn’t defeat Zorc!

programme.title: The Final Journey
programme.desc: Pharaoh Atem, Yugi and friends have defeated the bandit Bakura and Zorc, but the final test still awaits! Yugi must duel... Atem!

programme.title: The Final Duel, Part 1
programme.desc: The time of destiny is now! Yugi vs. Atem!

programme.title: The Final Duel, Part 2
programme.desc: Atem has summoned all three Egyptian Gods!

programme.title: The Final Duel, Part 3
programme.desc: Not only does Atem still have all three Egyptian God Cards, Yugi doesn’t have a single monster on the field!

programme.title: The Final Duel, Part 4
programme.desc: Yugi and Atem – more than friends, closer than brothers.

programme.title: Swing Into Action- Part 1
programme.desc: Yuya Sakaki aims to become an "Entertainment Duelist". He practices dueling every day alongside his childhood friend, Yuzu. One day, he receives a challenge for an exhibition match from the Pro Duelist, "Strong Ishijima". Although Yuya excitedly fends off his attacks in their Action Duel, he's eventually pushed into a corner.

programme.title: Swing Into Action- Part 2
programme.desc: With The Sledgehammer set to strike, Yuya uses Pendulum power to swing the duel his way! Can this phenomenal new summoning method help Yuya hammer the Hammer?

programme.title: Trade Bait - Part 1
programme.desc: It could be curtains for Yuya when a rival student cons him out of his Pendulum Cards!

programme.title: Trade Bait - Part 2
programme.desc: Still shocked by Sylvio's Pendulum Summon, Yuya must find his focus if he wants to save his friends from a 100-story drop!

programme.title: Toying Around - Part 1
programme.desc: The new kid in town drives Yuya bananas when he begs Yuya to be his duel teacher! Unfortunately for Yuya, this blue-haired battler won't give up until Yuya gives in!

programme.title: Toying Around - Part 2
programme.desc: Yuya's getting schooled by his wannabe student, Sora! Can Yuya turn things around and teach Sora a lesson about winning, or is Yuya's Pendulum power not going to make the grade?

programme.title: Mr. Mystery
programme.desc: Still steaming from his loss to Yuya, Sylvio looks to get some payback! But when Zuzu steps in to stop his plans, a mysterious stranger comes out of the shadows to show her how it's done!

programme.title: Bad Business
programme.desc: The Leo Institute is looking to take over Yuya's duel school, and they're bringing 3 of their most dangerous duelists to take down whoever dares stand in their way!

programme.title: Dueling with the Stars
programme.desc: The battle to save Yuya's duel school goes galactic when Yuya faces off against Leo Institute's Dipper, an out-of-this-world duelist whose interstellar skills could have Yuya seeing stars!

programme.title: You Show Em
programme.desc: It's a gem of a duel when Zuzu faces a fierce Fusion Summoner whose jewel monsters are a cut above the rest! Can Zuzu and her Divas belt out a victory, or will the Leo Institute's diamond of a duelist force a final face-off?

programme.title: Going, Going, Gong
programme.desc: It's all up to Gong to save You Show from falling into the hands of the Leo Institute! Can Gong stare down defeat without moving his feet, or will a sword-swinging Syncro Summoner slice and dice his way to victory?

programme.title: Battle Under The Big Top
programme.desc: It's a battle under the big top, but no one's clowning around! Yuya duels Declan to determine the fate of Yuya's duel school!

programme.title: Circus Surprise
programme.desc: Declan has a surprise in store that could swing the duel his way! Can Yuya take down the best the Leo Institute has to offer, or will Declan's deck prove to be unbeatable?

programme.title: The Show Must Go On
programme.desc: Yuya's down in the dumps, but Principal Boyle's not having it! Looking to snap Yuya out of his funk, Skip challenges Yuya to a duel to prove that the show must go on!

programme.title: In It To Win It
programme.desc: Still stinging from her defeat against the Leo Institute, Zuzu turns to an unlikely source for some assistance - Sora! But before her training can commence, a familiar looking stranger shows up, putting her lesson on hold!

programme.title: Menu Venue - Part 1
programme.desc: To gain eligibility to join the Junior Youth Championship, Yuya has to win 4 official duels consecutively. He ends up dueling is Michio Mokota, a cuisine Duelist with high popularity among the housewives.

programme.title: Truth and Consequences, Part 2
programme.desc: Sayer continues to manipulate Akiza in her Duel against Misty. Now, only Yusei can stop him by forcing him to reveal the truth about what really happened to Misty's brother the day of his death.

programme.title: Signs of Doom, Part 1
programme.desc: The King of the Netherworld arises from B.A.D. and approaches New Domino City. Rex Goodwin, who tries to use the powers of both a Signer and a Dark Signer to become a God, engages in a Turbo Duel with Yusei, Jack and Crow.

programme.title: Signs of Doom, Part 2
programme.desc: The Duel between Yusei, Jack, Crow, and Rex Goodwin continues. Rex Summons "Earthbound Immortal Wiraqocha Rasca" and uses its effect to reduce Crow's Life Points to 1. Due to massive injuries, Crow is unable to continue the Duel after falling off his Duel Runner.

programme.title: Signs of Doom, Part 3
programme.desc: Due to the effect of "Wiraqocha Rasca", Jack is blasted from the Duel. Now, only Yusei can save the world from Goodwin and stop the King of the Netherworld from reaching New Domino City.

programme.title: Go With the Flow - Part 1
programme.desc: In Heartland, Yuma Tsukumo aspires to be the world's best Duelist. Despite this, he is not a good Duelist. When he ends up Dueling, Shark, a student known to have pro-level skills, odd things begin to happen and Yuma's story begins.

programme.title: Go With the Flow - Part 2
programme.desc: The Duel between Yuma and Ryoga comes to its conclusion. In order to take down "Leviathan Dragon", Yuma obtains a "Number" monster of his own, "Utopia".

programme.title: In the End - Part 1
programme.desc: Astral's been unable to leave since Yuma Dueled Shark, so, despite his reluctance, he's begun living with Yuma. At an inconvenient time, Akari Tsukumo has trouble when her PC she uses as a stay-at-home reporter crashes. When her big scoop is deleted as a result of a system down the city suffered, she orders Yuma to find an alternate scoop she can use for another manuscript. When Yuma goes into town, the traffic lights go nuts, causing downtown to fall into chaos. Yuma looks for the criminal who spread the computer virus that caused all this chaos.

programme.title: In the End - Part 2
programme.desc: Yuma challenges Professor Kitano, who is behind it all. Professor Kitano notes that each time he reduces his opponent's Life Points with "Electronic Computer-Beast Tera Byte" Astral's body weakens, causing him to slowly vanish! To make things worse, the Explosive Virus Time Bomb Ukyo has set is slowly reaching its countdown.

programme.title: Flipping Out - Part 1
programme.desc: A strange shadow approaches Yuma, which turns out to be Tokunosuke Omoteura, a classmate of Yuma's known for his duplicitous tongue. In the morning, Yuma was reprimanded for a prank he pulled in front of the whole class that he has no memory of causing. As a result, he's been cut off from every one else. Tokunosuke gently says "Let's Duel". With "Baby Tragon" his new Xyz Monster, Yuma might enjoy this duel, but Tokunosuke seems to be planning something.

programme.title: Flipping Out - Part 2
programme.desc: Tokunosuke steals Yuma's "Utopia", causing Astral to vanish. Tokunosuke wanted the great power of Numbers, and Yuma tries to Summon "Leviathan Dragon" to fight back, but Tokunosuke's Trap Card takes even that away. When Yuma is pushed into a corner with his field, an unexpected monster will become the Trump Card of the Duel.

programme.title: The Sparrow - Part 1
programme.desc: After having been around a while and having to work with Yuma, Astral's been fascinated by a TV Show Hero named "Different Dimension ESPer Robin". For some reason, Astral feels close and similar to this Robin from an alternate universe. One day, pictures show up with Robin in a fight downtown! Yuma, prodded by Astral, goes with Kotori to where the autographs were taken and meets Robin's actor, a kid named Fuya! But Fuya is a timid boy who doesn't resemble the Robin they all admire in the slightest.

programme.title: The Sparrow - Part 2
programme.desc: The mysterious person posing as Robin around town was Fuya. Under the intolerable strain of being a hero, Fuya's heart has been overcome by darkness Yuma challenges him to a Duel to save his soul. Robin, however, possesses "Number 83: Galaxy Queen". With it, he proceeds to summon one character after another from the TV Show. At first, Yuma and Astral were amused by this, but due to Galaxy Queen's almighty Monster Effect, they quickly grow impatient. To make things worse, Galaxy Queen, who currently possesses Robin, has taken on the appearance of Fuya's mother.

programme.title: Menu Venue - Part 2
programme.desc: Yuya faces a ferocious attack against Michio Mokota's Cooking Duel.

programme.title: Trapped in a Card
programme.desc: It's a case of mistaken identity when Yuya is eyed as the primary suspect for attacking Leo students! But when Yuya crosses paths with the real culprit, things go from bad to worse!

programme.title: Quiz Quagmire - Part 1
programme.desc: Yuya matches minds with the quiz whiz extraordinaire Pierre L'Supérieure in a duel of wits! Can Yuya outsmart the smartest boy on Earth, or will Yuya end up scratching his head in defeat?

programme.title: Quiz Quagmire - Part 2
programme.desc: In the finale of the mind-bending match that's part-duel, part-quiz show - one wrong answer could mean curtains for Yuya! Can he outduel and outthink a trivia whiz who's never wrong?

programme.title: Beyond Belief
programme.desc: Duelists throughout the city are continuously being attacked, and everyone is on the search to find out the who, how and why!

programme.title: A Date With Fate - Part 1
programme.desc: Yuya's future takes a terrifying turn for the worse when he battles a fortunetelling foe who predicts this will be his last duel ever! Can Yuya fix his fate and avoid a devastating disaster, or has his luck finally run out?

programme.title: A Date With Fate - Part 2
programme.desc: As Yuya's battle against the fortunetelling predictress Aura flares to its finish, it becomes crystal clear that Yuya's danger-filled future is becoming a reality

programme.title: For Our Tomorrows
programme.desc: Mysteries are revealed when the masked duelist who's been terrorizing Leo Institute students is confronted and challenged to a battle royal!

programme.title: Battle Between Buddies - Part 1
programme.desc: Yuya needs one more win to get into the Championship, but it will be his most difficult battle yet when he discovers he has to beat his best bud Gong in order to move on!

programme.title: Battle Between Buddies - Part 2
programme.desc: The battle between best buds Yuya and Gong for a spot in the Arc League Championships rages to a friend-zied finish!

programme.title: Challengers Assemble
programme.desc: Let the games begin! The top duelists from around the globe have gathered together for the Arc League Championships to find out who's the best duelist in the world!

programme.title: Something's Fishy
programme.desc: Allie is looking to make a big splash at the Arc League Championship, but she soon finds herself in over her head! Can Allie's deck of fishy friends turn the tides, or will her mysterious opponent sink her chances of winning?

programme.title: Fusion Foes
programme.desc: Zuzu takes center stage in an epic rematch against Leo Institute's dueling diamond, Julia Krystal! Will Zuzu avenge her earlier loss and walk away a winner, or will history repeat itself and leave Zuzu singing the blues?

programme.title: Gong the Strong
programme.desc: When Gong's old sparring partner sets a trap for Yuya, the only way Gong can save his friend is to forfeit his duel and get tossed from the tourney!

programme.title: The Pendulum Swings Both Ways - Part 1
programme.desc: Sylvio finally has just the thing to take Yuya down - a deck full of Pendulum Cards! Could Yuya's days in the spotlight be done for?

programme.title: The Pendulum Swings Both Ways - Part 2
programme.desc: Yuya is off his game and on the run as Sylvio zeroes in on zeroing out his life points! If Yuya can't get into the swing of things, this could be his final performance!

programme.title: Making the Cut - Part 1
programme.desc: Sora is psyched to put on a showstopping duel for the fans, but his opponent Shay is set to turn Sora's one man show into a no man show!

programme.title: Making the Cut - Part 2
programme.desc: Sora and Shay's heated duel hits its boiling point when dark secrets about their hidden history come to light! Could there be something sinister behind Sora's sweet-toothed smile?

programme.title: Sora's Secret - Part 1
programme.desc: While Yuto is looking for answers, Sora is looking to get some revenge! But when these two tangle, Yuya finds out more than he ever expected!

programme.title: Sora's Secret - Part 2
programme.desc: Surprises are in the cards as the battle between Sora and Yuto comes to an unexpected conclusion! But just when Yuya thinks he's seen everything, a new face shows up on the scene that makes Yuya do a triple take!

programme.title: A Dark Reflection
programme.desc: Yuya can't believe his eyes when he finds himself standing face-to-face-to-face with two lookalikes who are out to destroy each other... and everything in sight!

programme.title: Warped Dimensions
programme.desc: Yuya is in a coma, and nothing has been able to stir him from his terrifying state! Is Yuya down for the count, or will his duelmate's ESP and TLC make him A-OK?

programme.title: A Duel Personality
programme.desc: Yuya's opponent is Isao Kachidoki from the Ryozanpaku School in the second round of the Maiami Championship.

programme.title: Stealth Warriors
programme.desc: When a mysterious visitor threatens to throw the Championship into chaos, Declan moves in to uncover who they are and soon finds himself facing off against a merciless mercenary!

programme.title: Bracing for Battle
programme.desc: Declan confronts Celina and shares a story from their past that reveals a frightening future!

programme.title: Battle Fields
programme.desc: It's time for a nail biting battle royal in the ARC League Championship! With four battle zones to choose from, the action has never been more mesmerizing or the duels more dangerous!

programme.title: Fire and Ice
programme.desc: While Yuya is looking to knock the competition out cold in the Volcano Zone, the Iceberg Zone is heating up as Zuzu and Gong team up to defrost their foes

programme.title: Danger Zones
programme.desc: As the battle royal rumbles on, Yuya finds himself caught in the crossfire when he stumbles across a battle between not-so-noble Knights!

programme.title: Obelisk Assault
programme.desc: Yuya takes on a terrifying trio from Fusion Dimension who turn their victims into cards!

programme.title: Dragon's Vengeance
programme.desc: Outnumbered, outmatched, and out of options, will Yuya tap into a deep-seeded darkness to overcome defeat?

programme.title: Identity Crisis
programme.desc: Zuzu races to stay one step ahead of a cold-blooded hunter who's hot on her heels! Can Zuzu ditch this danger, or will he prove too cunning for her to escape?

programme.title: Battlefronts
programme.desc: Sparks fly in the Volcano Zone when all our heroes face off against the full fury of Fusion Dimension's elite Obelisk Force! With more than life points on the line, the action has never been hotter!

programme.title: Fighting for Fun
programme.desc: Are friends now foes as Yuya and Sora go deck to deck in a fiery face-off?

programme.title: Dueling Declan
programme.desc: When Yuya discovers Declan's web of lies put his friends in danger, he challenges Declan to a battle as payback!

programme.title: Kings vs Dragons
programme.desc: Yuya’s battle with Declan takes a turn for the worse when Declan’s majestic monsters give Yuya the royal treatment!

programme.title: Parental Guidance - Part 1
programme.desc: It’s a family feud when Yuya takes on his mom in a duel where there’s more to lose than just his allowance! Can Yuya avoid being run down by Paradise City’s most feared motorcycle momma?

programme.title: Parental Guidance - Part 2
programme.desc: The battle between Yuya and his mom kicks into high gear! Can Yuya avoid being grounded, or will Loco Yoko put the pedal to the metal and throttle her way to victory?

programme.title: City 'Scape
programme.desc: As Zuzu and Yugo try to unravel the riddle of Yuya's dimensional doubles, their sleuthing is cut short by Sector Security!

programme.title: Tops Speed
programme.desc: Zuzu and Yugo redline their Duel Runner in a high-stakes Turbo Duel with Sector Security! Can they outrun the long arm of the law, or will Security put the brakes on their escape?

programme.title: Synchro Sector
programme.desc: When Yuya and his pals arrive in the Synchro Dimension, Sector Security is waiting for them with open arms… and cuffs! Can Yuya smooth things out before Sylvio and Celina put a wrinkle in his plan?

programme.title: Super Duelists
programme.desc: It’s a superheroic showdown in the Synchro Dimension pitting Super Gong against his arch-nemesis, Dennis the Destroyer!

programme.title: Scream for the Green
programme.desc: Dennis and Gong are in for the ride of their lives when they’re introduced to the turbo-charged world of underground motorcycle dueling!

programme.title: Feline Frenzy
programme.desc: A suspicious shadow is trailing Yuma. It seems someone has been after Yuma, and their identity is the unassuming girl Cat-chan from Yuma's class. Yuma and Kotori fall into Cat-chan's trap. To rescue Kotori, he's going to have to Duel. Astral is cautious of the strange vibes he's getting from Cat-chan, especially with the strategy of her "Transforming Cat Deck"!

programme.title: Shark Attack
programme.desc: Yuma is reminded that his victories in his current Duels are due to Astral's help. To prove his skills, he fights Shark once more. Though Shark doesn't care to Duel again, he finally agrees when he finally reaches the end of his rope due to Yuma's constant following him around. The Duel of these two begins. Can Yuma win against Shark, who has no "Number" cards, when he himself declares he won't use his "Number" cards or take the aid of Astral!?After his Duel with Shark, Yuma Duels Tetsuo Takeda without "Numbers" and loses twenty times in a row, with Tetsuo angry because Yuma lied about not using the "Numbers" against Shark. Yuma is scolded by Astral on his immaturity. On the other hand,...

programme.title: The Pack - Part 1
programme.desc: After his Duel with Shark, Yuma Duels Tetsuo Takeda without "Numbers" and loses twenty times in a row, with Tetsuo angry because Yuma lied about not using the "Numbers" against Shark. Yuma is scolded by Astral on his immaturity. On the other hand, Shark returns to "his place" where he gets involved with a criminal network. Yuma, who knew what was going on with Shark, challenges the two strongest thugs: Rikuo and Kaio, to what Shark proposes to be a 2 on 2 "Tag-Team Duel".

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Joon Jae panics when heard Sim Cheong went to the emergency room but Chi Hyeon says it was just an accident.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Joon Jae loses his memory of the time he spent with Sim Cheong at Spain. Dong Pyo looks for clues of murder.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Joon Jae gets confused of his feeling to Sim Cheong. He recalls Yang Seung Gil when ran into Ma Dae Young.

programme.desc: Joon Jae finds out that Ma Dae Young was the one who had threatened him and was looking for Sim Cheong.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Joon Jae wonders the meaning of the messages that Dam Ryeong sent through his dream.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Sim Cheong leaves the house in disappointment with Joon Jae. Meanwhile, Dong Pyo learns Ma Dae Young's secret.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.desc: Joon Jae tries to find Sim Cheong worrying that she's been out of contact for days.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea

programme.desc: Joon Jae finds something suspicious while looking for the clues of Ma Dae Young's kidnapping of Sim Cheong.

programme.title: The Legend of the Blue Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 The Legend of the Blue Sea
